review.title: Nice but very noisy
review.reviewText:
The room was fine-- there's is no desk or table to work on but the bed was comfortable and the amenities were very nice 

Ask for a room that does not face Poweel Street.  My room was on 4 and was extremely noisy-- street performers, and the cable cars runs right below your window which starts at 6am and runs until midnight 

The staff should supply ear plugs which they did when I complained 

The restaurant, Kuletos , is very very good -- you should definitely eat there
This hotel was in a good location but it was nothing special, and the room was just OK.  I wouldn't recommend it unless the price point is really in someone's acceptable range.

review.title: Old and. Expensive but excellent location
review.reviewText:
Location is very convenient. We were able to catch bus train, cable car,train easily. 
But very expensive and old.gym is old,dirty with poorly working equipment. 
Should have at least offerd a complimentary full breakfast. Over all it is not good for the money.

review.title: Central location
review.reviewText: The hotel was a little outdated,could use to get a makeover. But it was centrally located to everything. Was a little noisy with all the traffic.

review.title: great location on Union Square
review.reviewText:
Great spot in the heart of union square, staff were very helpful with information, directions and suggestions
Room was comfortable and clean!

review.title: Old hotel and greet location
review.reviewText: The staff were very helpful. I had a room in 2nd floor overlooking to the street and it was very noisy and the staff were happy to change it and apologies for it. It's a good hotel but seems old and the hallways were smelly. Honestly i pick this hotel because it was VIP+, but unfortunately there was nothing given to me from the VIP+ features at all and i don't blame the hotel for that I totally blame Expedia for it.

review.title: Nice on picture, not so much in reality
review.reviewText: If it was not for the horrible smell on the 7th floor, the clogged bathtub, the shaky WiFi, and the dust in the room, Villa Florence would have been a nice little hotel. Great location, great restaurant, and overall descent looking hotel despite the age of the building. The lobby was nicely renovated, but the rooms looked covered up more than anything. The size of the room was comfortable, but the bathroom was fairly small.
review.negativeRemarks: See review!
review.locationRemarks: Right in the middle of Union Square, close to the tram terminus and shopping centers.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location and the rooms have been recently updated however the staff is not attentive.  It seems as if they have many more important things to attend to instead of their customers.  It was difficult to know where to stop for the valet since there isn't anyone out front of the hotel and the street has a large do not enter sign.  We finally called the hotel and asked about the valet and they said to pull in front and leave the car and someone would valet it.  I explained that the two spots in front of the hotel were taken they said make a U-turn and park it on the other side, luckily there was one space to squeeze into.  We lugged our luggage across the street into the hotel and spoke to a man who was standing inside the door who I assume was the valet and he was very unconcerned about lending a hand or getting our car parked.  The rest of the staff wasn't any more impressive.  The gentleman who checked us in to a King Suite (which I booked because it slept 4 and we had our 2 kids with us) informed me unsolicited that he thought the couch pulled out but if not he could have a roll-away brought up.  I suggest he read his own web-site, I already knew the couch pulled out.  It's not a large hotel he should really know the 3 or 4 room configurations.  At check-out they tried to charge me again after I already paid Expedia.  Thank goodness I noticed it and questioned her, she then said "oh.. let me check".  I expected better.
review.positiveRemarks: The location and the rooms.  We were in a quiet area over looking a court yard.  The location can't be beat if you want to be in the thick of things.
review.negativeRemarks: The staff.  They aren't rude they are just completely uninterested. I didn't expect to be treated like a queen but I did expect to be acknowledged.

review.title: Best location. Amazing food. Fabulous staff
review.reviewText: This hotel should not be overlooked if you're planning a trip to San Francisco. The hotel is located just steps from great Union Square shops. Refreshed classic architecture and amazing food place it high on my list of places to return to.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: The hotel is centrally located in the heart of downtown SF, just steps away from Union Square and BART station. There is a price to pay though - noise, especially if your room overlooks the Powell street cable car line.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location for tourists

review.reviewText: Great location, but not worth the expense!  Had to settle for a smaller room as others were very noisy or had to get through a ridiculous maze after you get off the elevator to find your room.

review.title: Nice old hotel with great architecture
review.reviewText: Lots of charm!  The bathroom was a little small but everything was clean and it's a beautiful bldg
review.locationRemarks: Central to tons of activities

review.title: Great lication
review.reviewText: This hotel was great. Awesome location as we were close to everything in Union square and walking distance from everything else.

review.title: Centre of San Francisco
review.reviewText: This hotel has it all; professional and attentive staff, comfortable and well appointed rooms, an amazing restaurant, and steps from shopping, transportation and nightlife.  I would recommend the Villa Florence to the first time and seasoned traveller to San Francisco.
review.locationRemarks: It is so centrally located you can walk to everything.

review.title: Nice hotel close to union square
review.reviewText: Very clean Italian styled hotel, nice restaurant inside, close to shopping

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: It's located close to the action in the heart of downtown. Cable cars run right in front of the hotel. Half a block from Union Square and tons of bus tours to see everything.
Was nice and clean. Parking garage across the street for $2.25 an hour avoided $60 valet fee.

review.title: The location of the hotel could not be better!
review.reviewText: Spent a week in San Francisco exploring the city.  Great food, fabulous weather, and wonderful scenery!  One day we went to a Giants game and had a blast.  We took BART from airport to Powell station walked two blocks and we were at the hotel.  It is right in Union Square, all the shopping is in any direction you walk.  We bought transit passes for the week and were able to go anywhere in the city.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel has world charm.  Being an older building makes it quaint with newer improvements making the stay very comfortable.

review.title: Nice hotel but pricey and lacking amenities
review.reviewText:
The staff were friendly and the location is good and close to union square if shopping is your thing.  It is a pricey hotel with small rooms, no pool, no hot tub and I did not see a vending machine or place to purchase snacks without leaving the hotel.
Forget eating in the hotel if you are on a budget.  Over $100 for an adult and child with one drink each and no desert.  Ensure you purchase snacks and drinks for your room as a large bottle of water is $15.00 in the room.
Lower your prices on food and room snacks and drinks and make it up on customers purchasing and eating at the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: The front desk staff were great and the hotel itself was clean
review.negativeRemarks: Cheaper pricing without a doubt.
review.locationRemarks: If you are into shopping at expensive stores day after day, the location is good.

review.title: Location, location, location.
review.reviewText: If you want to be on Union Square then this is a great place to be.  The hotel entrance and lobby are a nice contrast to the store fronts that surround them ... the coffee bar is good and breakfast in the restaurant was fantastic ... and with a 20% discount for residents it was good to see the price as reasonable as many of the "diners" around it with long lines outside between 0900 and 1030.  We had a junior suite which was very pleasant without being exceptional or memorable ... but the staff in the hotel were  consistently very helpful and friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: The elevators and corridors are a bit tired ... but we got over any negative first impressions quickly
review.locationRemarks: Unless you want to be on the "piers" this is a great place for shopping, eating, drinking and of course Chinatown.

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: while the rooms are a bit dated, they are very clean and comfortable. We had a great stay and would stay again.

review.title: Great Location in Union Square right in the heart
review.reviewText: The hotel stay was an absolute joy. The staff was very helpful at all times and the rooms were always clean tidy. A little small and crammed bathroom but then again this is Francisco where space is premium. The Restaurant in the hotel was very good and so was the little cafe with some of the best croissants this side of the Atlantic.The only suggestion would be is to have more staff available on the front desk during peak hours and allow Uber/Lyft drivers to pull up to the front door.
review.negativeRemarks: Better Happy Hour instead of the Three bottles hidden by the front desk if not just do away with the idea all together.
review.locationRemarks: Location is right in the hear of Union Square. Tons of shopping, restaurant's and bars in walking distance. I mean within a 4 block radius

review.title: Good location, pleasant, not amazing.
review.reviewText:
Overpriced for what it is, I guess that's just San Fran. We had an interior facing room which just looked at other room's shutters. That was a bummer, but it was very very quiet, especially for being right in the middle of the hustle and bustle. The coffee maker in the room was very odd, it was in a drawer that couldn't pull out all the way because the cord was plugged in right through the drawer. It made it not really possible to use. They delivered a hot water kettle for tea but we still couldn't make coffee. They gave my husband coffee each morning in the lobby, but it would have been nice to make it in the room in the afternoon or evening. 
Molly at the front desk, Daniel at the concierge desk and Christine through email and text were all very helpful and friendly. They made our stay go from below average to above average, with late checkout and nice attitudes.

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for four days and loved it!  So clean and well kept, amazing staff that goes above and beyond for you, nice modern clean rooms, very comfortable bed, etc.  It was our anniversary so the manager sent up champagne and chocolate cake for us the first night, which was a really nice surprise.  Everyone was so friendly, willing to help with anything, we would definitely stay here again!  And as a bonus, it was the perfect location, right in the middle of the hustle and bustle of the downtown life. Highly recommend!!
review.locationRemarks: Lots of great shopping nearby, restaurants, pubs and bars!  Also, Kuletos restaurant is attached to the hotel, which has amazing food!

review.reviewText: It is a old unkept hotel. Not a four star hotel as stated on Expedia.

review.title: Nice hotel, great location.
review.reviewText: We had a very pleasant stay at Villa Florence Hotel . The location has everything you need within walking distance. The room was clean and very comfortable. The bed was very comfortable. The staff were  friendly and professional. Although there are probably more modern hotels to stay near by, my family was completely satisfied and we would stay there again. Room 507 one bedroom suite.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: First time to San Francisco without a car. We use the Bart from airport drop us on Market st which was two short blocks from hotel and lots of places near by to grab a bite to eat. Hotel is really in a good location for public transportation. Hotel has paking at $60 a night   so much easier to use public transportation.

review.title: Older hotel, ok.  Would not be back
review.reviewText:
This Hotel is an older hotel and has been nicely updated, as you would expect the rooms are small, and the bath’s even smaller.  That said the big disappointments for us were the house keeping, one day only bath towels no hand or wash cloths, and a shower that backed  up around your ankles.  

While the restaurant staff at Kuletos was extremely attentive, the kitchen is not what it used to be.  We ate there twice, the Seafood Cobb Salad came pretty much with out andy dressing, minestrone soup was very average.   Ordered the Seafood pasta for dinner, sent it back - shrimp way over done, no seasoning, muscles questionable - sent it back.   With out the great staff this restraint would be closed.
review.negativeRemarks: Restaurant, housekeeping, elevators, and Valet parking ($68/night) and minimally helpful.
review.locationRemarks: Miserable location, it unclear if you can even turn down the street where the entrance is.

review.title: Great location with easy access to BART
review.reviewText: Check in was fast and efficient with an offer of champagne.  Received a welcome text from concierge offering help when needed.  Room was small but was as advertised.  TV was Samsung but the remote did not work properly.  HVAC system was controlled through remote that was quirky and hard to turn off.  Bathroom did not have any usable shelf space to put toiletries on.  Room was clean, but sheets and towels were stained.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was great with close access to shopping and restaurants, but most importantly, close to BART.
review.negativeRemarks: Making sure towels and sheets are stain free before checking the room off as ready.

review.title: Heart of Union Square
review.reviewText: The hotel is located in the heart of Union Square, San Francisco's main shopping area. The hotel is conveniently located minutes away from the Bay Area Rapid Transit (Powell street station), which is a 30 minutes train ride to/from the airport. The hotel has a restaurant and café, but Starbucks and many other restaurants are right next door. My room was very quiet as requested. It was spacious and clean. I really liked the snacks and drinks in the fridge. Check-in was quick. However, the staff could be warmer with guests.  Also, the cleaning lady knocked at my door early in the morning and kept coming every half hour so that was annoying. The next day I put the "quiet please" tag in front of my door before going to sleep and no one bothered me. When I left the room I turned the tag, which read "service please" (if I remember correctly).
Great location for shopping room was nice the toilet make a loud disruptive notice for about 2 min after each flush which was really only an issue at night when others trying to sleep

review.title: 1 Night in San Francisco for Business
review.reviewText:
Room extremely small, room smelled like old rotten carpet or something, Extreme amount AC noise both from the room and from the Adjacent rooms. AC going on and off was terrible lost several hour f sleep.
Went for breakfast they told us they were shutting it down for lunch. The manger tried to get us in they refused that was really rude.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, Location, Location and Friendly Staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Smelly, Nose level perhaps with sound proof Windows and doors.
review.locationRemarks: Heart of the business district, Shopping, and Restaurants, and very near the Fisherman Worf.

review.title: Good central location
review.reviewText: Spent one night, friendly staff. Would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Lost Expedia Reservation
review.reviewText: Reservation didnt go through. Staff was accomodating. Room wasnt 4 star quality. Fitness center was horrible.

review.title: Charming Hotel with a nice remodel.
review.reviewText: We did enjoy ourselves during our recent stay.  Located in the middle of the Union Square area with lots of restaurants and the trolley car right outside of the hotel.  We were there with our kids, who are teenagers.  Our room was large enough for 4 people to fit.  The bed was comfortable, the bathroom had a pocket door separating the sink from the shower area, which came in handy.  It did work out well for us.  My criticism would be that the building has a smell.  It's like old wood mixed with food.  That probably sounds stupid but it was a very strong smell. So strong that I was worried about my clothes smelling when we left.  They did not, by the way.  It was fine, but The staff should probably consider opening windows on the upper floor or investing in some air fresheners.  Also, if you need something, the front desk does not answer the phone.  You need to go downstairs and speak directly to them.  It was not a big deal at all since we were always coming and going so we just spoke to them as we passed by, when we were in need of information or extra blankets.  Also, grab water bottles from a surrounding store. Bottles for purchase in the room were too expensive.  I would stay here again, regardless of the smell.
review.positiveRemarks: The location was good if you want to be in the middle of Union Square.  The room size was good for a family.
review.negativeRemarks: The staff should look into ventilation, due to the smell.
review.locationRemarks: You can hop on a trolley car, unless it is during a busy time, right outside the hotel.  Shopping is endless.

review.title: Great hotel in the midst of it all!
review.reviewText: I really loved Villa Florence from the moment I walked inside. The staff was happy and helpful and my room was even better than I could have expected.
Great place and location! I defently would stay there again!

review.title: Good central location
review.reviewText: It's a little hard to find and the signs that say "Do Not Enter" on both sides of the block lead you to believe you can't turn onto that part of the street...however, you can.  The locals know that but obviously visitors don't so no matter what the sign says, you can in fact turn on to that street for the purpose of checking in and unloading your car.  We were able to check in early at 11:00 which was very nice.  The hotel decor is really cute and even though the room is small, it is very clean and cozy.
review.positiveRemarks: It is on Powell Street which is were the Cable Cars run so you can catch it on either street beside the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Helpful tips from the bell/concierge staff about things to do.  They answered the questions we had but more insight would have been great.
review.locationRemarks: You have to buy your Cable Car ticket at the end of Powell but don't wait in the line there.  Walk up the street where the hotel is to get on quicker.

review.title: A Gem in the Middle of Everything
review.reviewText: Villa Florence is a little gem of a hotel right mack in the middle of downtown SF. Everything is only steps away: restaurants, shopping, and transportation to all points of interest. SF's historic trolley, Union Park across from Macy's with its rooftop Cheesecake Factory, city buses that get you to the Ferry Building, Ghirardeli Square, Fisherman's Wharf, etc. Love the hotel, the hotel staff  was friendly and accommodating.

review.title: Not all it is made out to be
review.reviewText: Hotel was okay but definitely not as good as it is made out to be.   Room was quite small and bathroom very small as well.   Lobby looked like it needed a good clean.   Would not recommend.

review.title: Disorganized check-in, housekeeping, & small room
review.reviewText: After checking in we were given keys to a room that was clearly still occupied by another hotel guest. I believe the poor woman was still using her bathroom when we keyed into the room. Upon returning to the front desk, the mix up was treated very casually and the next room we were given was very small, with barely enough room for the queen bed to face the door and with no counter space in the bathroom. We were woken the next morning at 8am by housekeeping; we had planned on leaving the room around 10 so had not posted the Do Not Disturb sign because we didn't expect them to stop by so early in an occupied room. We came back in the late afternoon to find that housekeeping had left a bottle of cleaning spray out on the table. It just seemed as if the attention to detail at the Villa Florence was not what we would have expected for the price we were paying.

review.title: Staff is very unhelpful - Worst Service Ever!
review.reviewText:
Our restroom had a stink to it and why I asked the front desk to switch rooms - they said they were full and they would bring a spray to help mask the scent (they never showed up). 

I then asked for house slippers which they said they would bring up & I waited for 30 minutes and called back to follow-up, they said they had run out. 

The RUDEST front desk person is the tall gentlemen with the curly hair - he needs to learn how to be in the business of service.

review.title: In the heart of the shopping district.
review.reviewText: Very nice, older hotel. The staff was wonderful. I was traveling with my teenage children. We did quite a bit of walking to the different points of interest in San Fran. Only complaint was no one would answer the phone when we were trying to figure out how to park.
best location convenient to everything you need to do in SF.

review.title: Great location but..
review.reviewText: Great area right in Union square. Staff great and friendly.  Rooms are very small for the price. Feels very crowded, like an old room refurnished. Rooms seem to be better fitted for one person at a time.  One major issue is that the main door of the room has a large gap between the door and the floor.  Pretty good privacy and security issue.  Had to place a pillow to cover the space. Would probably stay here on a solo trip.
Great location,  staff and room. No view and window ac were a drawback. Otherwise highly recommended.

review.title: Good location in the middle of union square conved
review.reviewText: Macy's 2 min away and summer sales were amazing plus amount of different stock.... incredible choice . hop on off bus always good value and a great way to be informed and see the city.Third time to San Francisco each time a totally new experience and find more to see this time visited botanical and Japanese gardens ,very impressed with the pianos in botanical garden a wonderful idea.
review.negativeRemarks: Prices on wine and food .
review.locationRemarks: Shopping great and transport

review.title: Parking nightmare
review.reviewText: This hotel is nice with close proximity to shopping and theaters , but valet parking is a nightmare. With only two spaces to pull into you'll waste a good hour circling the block until a space opens up! It really is a crap shoot when it comes to being able to pull in or not! They say you can get your own spot in a garage for 35 bucks if you don't mind hauling your luggage through the streets or pay the 60 for valet!

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Quaint hotel, not crazy expensive.  Great location, close to so much!  Comfortable rooms, though a little small.  Nice if you don't want a big chain hotel.  Staff was very friendly.  Housekeeping did an ok job, didn't wash our coffee cups, would make the bed but not put the decorative pillows back on, which I found a little odd.  Had breakfast a few mornings in the restaurant which was very good - great coffee!  Overall, I would stay here again and recommend.
review.negativeRemarks: Housekeeping!
review.locationRemarks: Close to restaurants, Starbucks, Union Square and Walgreens was right down the street for food, meds, etc.

review.title: Great place to stay.
review.reviewText: Excellent staff and hotel conditions! Would of liked to looked over the city from the roof, but hell you can't have it all right? ;)

review.title: Classic facility in the heart of San Francisco
review.reviewText: This hotel is what can be expected for a facility built decades ago in the middle of a city like San Francisco.  The lobby is grand, with high ceilings, mirrors, artwork, and well-dressed staff.  However, the room itself barely contained the two double beds, the single window provided a clear view of the next building six feet away, the bathroom was small even for one person, and the toilet made weird sounds when flushed. Nevertheless, the room was clean and quiet and therefore fulfilled its purpose for us.  The location is 50 yards from Union Square, which therefore provides a wide selection of restaurants for breakfast or dinner as well as being centrally located for access to many of the attractions of San Francisco.

review.title: Museum hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel looked old , I was expecting more for  what we paid.The lobby looked nice, but when we got upstairs in those tiny elevators we could feel the narrow and creepy sidewalks ,we had the sensation  that we were in a maze.The room wasn't clean as we were expecting ,not even a free bottle of water for a welcome!.For that price, you can get a better hotel. The only good thing was the location.

review.title: Can't be beaten for proximity!
review.reviewText: The hotel is incredibly close to Union Square, shopping, and Bart, and for that, the price was well worth it! The room was super small, (which I know is common in big cities) as was the elevator but the one real negative for me was the bathroom floor which was so slippery it was treacherous. Otherwise, we were happy with the service and cleanliness of the room.

review.title: Great location,but very noisy.
review.reviewText: We had asked for a quiet room.  The man who checked us in said we had a great room.  After we got settled, the street niose became very loud.  They offered to move us, but we had unpacked and chose to stay in our room-Mistake!  There was also a $58 parking charge that we were not told about.  When we checked out, the manager adjusted our bill and apologized for our trouble.

review.title: Fantastic central location
review.reviewText: This hotel is all about location.its basically on Union square.Easy walk to everything .Small room,old hotel,stinky.AC did not work,very small bathroom.Its not a 4 star hotel! We used public parking nearby. It's not enough to convince me to return.

review.title: A over rated rotel
review.reviewText:
The hotel is located at a prime business location. But there are good hotels near by.
I had a cold welcome in the reception ; as if I dont have a option to stay any where else.
None of plus membership offering was show cased or offered.

Once I reach into my room I observed patch all aroud the walk way and in anroud the room.
Seems the hotel is not mainted for long time.

Wash room was tooo small ;to stand and towels were dirty.
the linen on the bed were dirty ; so how I spent my night with my familly.
Staff were not at all friendly.
There was no trash in the floor.

This should be demoted to just a regular hotel so that customer dont get false expectation
review.locationRemarks: I would never recomend any one to visit this hotel as there are plenty for good hotels near by with same price.

review.title: Affordable hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText: We spent three nights here over the 4th of July weekend.  The hotel offered great service at a reasonable price within walking distance of Union Square and multiple transportation options to other parts of the city.  We purchased 3-day SFMTA Passports at the Walgreens on Powell Street less than a block from our hotel.  We walked to Chinatown, rode the cable cars to Fisherman's wharf, and took the municipal bus to the Golden Gate bridge.  There is a BART station one block from the hotel as well.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel was in a great location, the room was clean and comfortable, and the staff was friendly and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: We did not encounter anything that could be improved on our trip.  We thoroughly enjoyed our stay.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is located less a block from Union Square and multiple transportation options.  There are many shopping, dining, and entertainment options.

review.title: Great location. Garage nearby
review.reviewText: convenient garage and wonderful location for walking around San Francisco

review.title: Great hotel in Union Square
review.reviewText:
Cons: The Villa Florence offers bottled water in the room for $15! Ridiculous! Walk down the  street to Walgreen's and get 2 bottles for $3.

Pros: The Villa Florence is in a great location of SF. Great restaurants and easy public transportation is very close (Cable Car, BART system, and buses). We faced the street and loved it; however, if you like a quiet room ask for an inside room. The bed was the most comfortable bed I ever slept on!  I was impressed at the size of the room for SF. It was roomy and comfortable. The staff at the Villa Florence is the best. They are extremely helpful and courteous! From housekeeping to Limo and the front desk to Daniel V at the door! Amazing staff!

I would absolutely come back to the Villa Florence!

review.title: Overnight Trip
review.reviewText: We went for an overnight stay and our room was nice but the bed was uncomfortable and we were on the street side of the hotel and our window was right on union square and it was very very noisy my husband and I didn't sleep pretty much the entire night.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText:
Brought two 12 yr olds for an 8 day visit to San Francisco. This hotel is centrally located with the Cable cars running past the front door in Union Square.  Parks, restaurants & sightseeing right there. Great value. The conceriege (Daniel) offered excellent suggestions on things to do. 
Wouldn't stay anywhere else.
review.negativeRemarks: I don't know. Stayed in a large room on the 6th floor and it was suitable for 2 adults & 2 children.
review.locationRemarks: China town, market square area, Union Square Park, Yerba Buena Gardens which has a skating rink, bowling alley, childrens' museum & restaurants.

review.title: Ok hotel
review.reviewText: Desk staff didn't  have a clue.  Offered upgrades yet unavailable.  Offered early check in but even at 5 pm rooms not available. At checkout computer down again and no receipt for stay and dont know what they will charge dince still have not received bill or receipt.  Staff was more interested in talking personal business then helping guests and even became annoyed when they were interrupted and would walk off.

review.title: Heart of the city
review.reviewText: Great time in the city. So easy to get around. Would stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: easy check in and check out. all kept hotel
review.negativeRemarks: more shelves in bathroom
review.locationRemarks: great location, centrally located to all modes of transportation

review.title: Great Spot in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Great location to expand out and see San Francisco.  Having a teenager I could have used better wifi and being stuck on the back of the building there was no hope of a good cell signal.  This particular room has zero view (brick wall).  I've stayed before and the view was fine for a crowded downtown that time.  The room was a bit tight on space but overall it was clean and comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: The wifi was horrible.  Extra horrible. It wasn't even good in the middle of the night.  The signal was strong.  Other guest said same thing.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square.  Cable cars and shopping.

review.title: Nice quiet hotel near public transportation
review.reviewText: The staff was great. Very nice and welcoming. We had a small leak in the bathroom that was fixed immediately and no other issues. Great location in union square

review.title: Extremely helpful and friendly staff
review.reviewText: This hotel is in an excellent location near Union Square, shopping, and dining.  We requested a quiet room (the hotel is facing a busy street) and were given a very quiet room on the 3rd floor.  The desk staff apologized that there wasn't a view (not important to us) but it was quiet.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  Our room was nice, cool (air conditioned), and clean.  The only negative: the king bed seemed old and the pillows were lumpy.  Also, a quilt is not necessary or comfortable unless you crank the air down quite a bit.
review.positiveRemarks: The location, the friendly staff, the evening champagne
review.negativeRemarks: The beds could be upgraded, new pillows, get rid of the quilts
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location close to Union Square, cable cars, shopping, lots of dining choices, and there is a Starbucks close by

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: The location was perfect. We were steps away from the cable cars. Powell station was just down the street to catch the Bart to and from the airport. Lots of great shopping and restaurants.

review.title: Nice Hotel, close to reataurants and shops.
review.reviewText: We enjoyed the stay at this hotel. The only negative experience was the attendant that brought up our car from Valet 15 minutes later, he stood there and watched me while i loaded 5 bags into the trunk. Did not greet us or say a word to us or attempt to help. Against my better judgement i still tipped him!! The rest of the experience was good.

review.title: Honeymoon
review.reviewText: Small but eloquent rooms, in the heart of downtown life. Cheap uber to fishermans wharf or you can ride the trolley. Very nice staff

review.title: In  walking distance of many visitor attractions
review.reviewText: We were looking for a central downtown, boutique type hotel, and Villa Florence met those requirements well, being close to Union Square. The disadvantage is that Powell Street is a very busy city thoroughfare, with heavy pedestrian traffic that makes getting around somewhat trying. We asked for, and were given, a back room overlooking the courtyard and thus experienced no problems with street or other noise
review.positiveRemarks: While the hotel was clearly an older establishment, the guest rooms have been very well updated and nicely furnished. Staff were friendly & polite.
review.negativeRemarks: The bathroom, though nicely renovated, was tiny. Not sure whether there would be space for these to be enlarged, however
review.locationRemarks:
Location is excellent for exploring the central shopping and sightseeing areas. Easy access to trams, trains & tour buses.
But very busy sidewalks

review.title: great downtown location, reasonably priced
review.reviewText: The motel itself is quaint and slightly dated, but in a nice way...it appears classic, not just old!  The rooms are comfortable, quiet and large enough for a couple.  It is also within walking distance of many businesses, bus lines, and not too far to Bart if you like to walk....tough with a larger bag, okay with a carry on. We have stayed here many times and will stay here again.
review.locationRemarks: See above

review.title: Great location for walking all around Union Square
review.reviewText:
Great hotel staff and a very nice lobby. Easy to get around by foot and near lots of shopping, restaurants, and bars. 
Rooms were smaller than expected but the hotel is an old building. The decor is up to date and our room had a nice giant flat screen tv. Not much closer space but we made do.
Overall it was perfect for our weekend stay in SF!

review.title: Located in the heart of San Francisco action
review.reviewText:
The Villa Florence is situated in the midst of Union Square activity.  The price of that convenience is the noise factor in rooms facing Powell Street - cable cars just outside the building and traffic and crowd noises until late at night.  If you can put that aside and let air conditioning drown out the rabble you will enjoy the updated rooms and helpful staff.  
Lobby and restaurants are recessed away from Powell St. Entrance giving the sense of a quiet enclave.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable bed and bedding. Clean rooms and baths .  Pleasant staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Soundproofing?  Maybe I'll just request a room not facing Powell Street next time.
review.locationRemarks: A block away from cable car ticket booth and in the opposite direction a block away from great retail.

review.title: Remodeled hotel by Union Square
review.reviewText: Friendly and Attentive Staff. Room was small with nice amenities. Only inconvenience was the shower that did not drain well. Overall a well priced and nice hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Our shower did not drain well
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, walking distance to the pier, china town, north beach

review.title: Excellent location, clean and cozy!
review.reviewText: The hotel is a good location, easy to walk from it to other locations around the city.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Id you use there valet. It is a horrible experience. No where for u easily drive up too and pick up your car. Really bad experience. Had to unload across the street and also load.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice. Great decor, clean rooms. Wasn't too happy to be charged more for parking a truck in valet at a whooping $78!!!

review.title: Great location to catch trolley to pier 39
review.reviewText: I'd stay here again.  Close to restaurants, bars and shopping

When I arrived and wanted to check in there was no one in the front desk for 5 minutes. The rooms had a bad smell, and there were insects in the bathroom. Moreover, the AC didn't work well, and the Windows didn't resist the loud noise out of the hotel. 

This is absolutely not a 4 star hotel! Not even 2!

review.title: great location
review.reviewText:
Hotel is clean, comfortable, and perfectly located next to Union square. Have stayed there many times and it seems to get better every time.
Had a car for the last night and decided to use their valet parking. For 62 buck for 1 night it took them one hour to return the car, which almost caused me to extend the car rental for even more money.
review.negativeRemarks: The lobby bar closes at 8pm, does not make much sense.
review.locationRemarks: right next to Union square and right on the cable car to Fishermans Wharf, walking distance to convention center.

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: We were only in San Francisco for about 20 hours, but this hotel is where I will stay next time I'm in town. Great location near Union Square with great shopping and many restaurants to suit any taste. Love it!
review.positiveRemarks: This hotel is quite charming! The bar is fun and the restaurant is great!

review.title: Hotel is in a great location in union square
review.reviewText: great location and access to BART system to and from airport.  Rooms are clean but not having 2 queen beds in a room is a bit disappointing.  This is a boutique hotel - bathrooms are dated but clean.  Beds are comfortable.  Great restaurants all around the hotel.  Have stayed 3 times but may try something different next time….
review.negativeRemarks: having two queen beds in a room rather than double beds would be more comfortable for families
review.locationRemarks: great access to restaurants in union square, access BART system and cable car turn-a-around is great.

review.title: Clean hotel, right in the center, close to Convent
review.reviewText: Paid almost $70 valet parking for one night and waited almost an hour for it to be returned.

review.title: Very nice place.
review.reviewText: No problems here at all. Good value for the money.

review.title: Amazing hotel close to everything.
review.reviewText: This hotel is super cute and clean. I loved all the decorations and the small boutique feel as well as the glass of complimentary champagne at check in. It is right on the trolley line and public transportation was super easy. The hotel is located right in the center of everything. Staff was friendly and cleaned the room really well. The only negative is that they require a "security" deposit of a hundred dollars a night that was not disclosed until check in. As we stayed 4 nights, $400 would have taken up most of our spending money if we wouldn't have had an extra credit card.

review.title: Nice, unique hotel
review.reviewText:
We had a great experience here. Very friendly and accommodating staff, prompt service. A great change of pace from the standard Marriotts, Hyatts, etc. Only issue we had was our keycards stopped working when we got home one night, but they replaced the cards promptly. (Note: the shampoo, etc. is locked to a container, you can't take home the bottles)

Pros:
-Convenient location
-Unique design
-Comfortable pillows
-Great staff

Cons:
-Stiff mattress
-Small bathroom
-Not enough counter space at sink
-Breakfast in lobby is a little expensive
review.negativeRemarks:
Softer mattress
Different sink in bathroom, not enough counter space

review.title: Good choice for downtown SF
review.reviewText: Central location on Union Square. Room was nice and bed was comfortable. Only complaint was the street noise in early am. There is a lot if construction going on in Union Square so it helps to bring ear plugs!

review.title: Close to shopping, very convenient.
review.reviewText: This hotel was clean and close to attractions which made the stay convenient. Rooms are tiny but I'm also from rural Kansas. Staff was incredible and very attentive.

review.title: Only stayed cause it was a Vip hotel
review.reviewText: But there's nothing vip about it . I didn't get a room upgrade I payed 60 bucks for parking a night they gave me 20 percent of the restaurant but everyone that stay there gets 20 percent of lol . Wouldn't stay here again staff seems understaffed there's no one at the front to call for taxi or get your call . Room was nice but bed was comfortable air conditioning wasn't that great only good thing I really liked about the hotel was the location walking distance from shopping center so for the price to stay there is rather stay some where else .

review.title: Nice hotel close to Union square
review.reviewText: I could reach to almost everywhere from this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Location close to everywhere. easy to get any kind of transportation
review.negativeRemarks: More discount or better room upgrade
review.locationRemarks:
shopping area everywhere.
Fisherman's warf
Sausalito
Golden gate bridge

review.reviewText: The room was comfortable, except that the noise generated the air conditioner was too high and the wind from it was too strong.

review.title: Love the hotel and its location!
review.reviewText: Stayed there for our wedding anniversary. Great location and nice room decor. Overall it was great!
In our first room, the TV, air conditioning and phone were not working but they moved us to a new room once we noticed all this! Very friendly staff.

photos.caption: Cable cars being turned by its crew.
Down the hills of San Francisco.

review.title: Nice hotel in the center of San Francisco!
review.reviewText: The room in Villa Florence was exactly as shown in the Expedia picture. We were in the center of union square, the shopping district of the city and the historic cable car ran right in front of the hotel on Powell street. The concierge was especially nice explaining how to get around and where to put our cars for valet service.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location, rooms outdated though. AC did not work

review.title: Nice hotel very close to all the SF shopping & ...
review.reviewText: The hotel is very nice.  I rate it a good 4.  Hotel staff was excellent, my only complaint was the bed mattresses were word pretty good and kind of too soft for someone needing a firm mattress for back.  Otherwise, this older hotel remodeled to be up to date.  Hallways and such are older, but the rooms are very nicely remodeled and modern.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, cost in SF, and nicely remodeled.  Staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Mattresses newer
review.locationRemarks: shopping, tourism

review.title: Right in Union Square!
review.reviewText: Great front lobby with dining area right there. Old style charm with updated interiors
Very nice, friendly staff, older rooms however, well appointed, we enjoyed our stay.

review.title: Nice hotel well situated
review.reviewText:
This hotel is in a great location for visiting San Francisco.  We had two rooms, one a twin with two double beds and another a King Size.  On arrival we were asked if we wanted the larger twin room (great as the kids are now quite old for sharing), however it was at the front of the hotel and quite noisy - this was explained at the time and the kids didn't mind as they got a larger room.  Our King size room was on the same floor but in the centre of the hotel.  Both rooms were very clean and spacious, however a bit 'old', I guess these had yet been refurbished.  I would also say that our room suffered from constant Aircon noise, although as it was constant we soon tuned it out.  The bar area is small but a nice place to sit and enjoy happy hour before going out for dinner.

All the staff were excellent and could not do enough to help you .... well done guys!
review.negativeRemarks: They need to complete the refurbishment and see if they can do anything with the aircon noise
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is in a great position for visiting the city and sits at the beginning of the tram line

review.reviewText: Great Location! Room was fantastic. Shopping, restaurant and museums are all walking distance. Staff was awesome.

review.title: Close to almost everything the city has to offer.
review.reviewText: Staff are very friendly and professional. However, staff on Sunday morning, April 10, was totally oblivious as to what his role is while working at the Cafe. It was around 8AM when we went down for breakfast and we stood there waiting for him to even acknowledge our presence but to no avail. He was too busy chatting with another customer. We continue to wait for another 5 minutes then left. We were standing across him but that wasn't enough to call his attention which obviously not in his vocabulary or job description.

review.title: Overnight stay
review.reviewText: The staff we polite. Our room was comfortable and quite. Very small bathroom.

review.title: Fresh contemporary decor, excellent location
review.reviewText:
My double bedded room was smaller than expected but fine for one person. The air conditioner was noisy - replacing it with a quieter unit would be a huge improvement. A brochure of some kind in the room to describe the hotel services would have been useful.

Otherwise I loved the contemporary unique decor and welcoming environment. The staff was friendly and helpful. There is a nice lobby, restaurant and coffee/wine bar with a discounted happy hour. The location - just off Union Square and minutes from Bart - couldn't be better. 
I highly recommend this hotel for short stays.
Room was very clean.  Small bathroom but remodeled.  Confortable beds

review.title: Wonderful location
review.reviewText: Overall it was fine.  Perfect location.  Nice lobby.  Adjacent to an Italian restaurant that offers a good discount to guests. The rooms are small especially with two double beds.  No room to walk around in the room.  The pillows were very subpar..  My bathroom was tiny.  The tub floor was slippery.  No makeup/shaving mirror.  There was no where to sit other than the desk chair or one of the beds.

review.title: Hotel with flair right next to Union square
review.reviewText: The hotel's location is premium. It is right in the shopping center of San Francisco. Located on the street of one of the cable cars and two blocks away from Market street, the location couldn't be better. Our room had it's own flair - the Windows opened to a light channel between houses that also has all the window AC units. The bath was tiny and hadn't been remodeled in a while. If antique is your thing, this is the hotel to be.

photos.caption: Yerba Buena park on Howard St

review.title: Great location near Union Square.
review.reviewText:
Found my stay very satisfying. The restaurant Kuletos is great. There is also a Cafe located in the lobby which is
very good. Easy walking distance to all kinds of places, including Yerba Buena Gardens, an open space park on Howard St.
review.negativeRemarks: There was a vent in the bathroom that had a continuous sound which one can get use to.
review.locationRemarks: A half block from Union Square and easy walking to shops and Powell and Market Street cable car.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Hotel is very centrally located. The rooms are beautiful. The bathroom is a bit small but that's common in SF. I would definitely recommend it! Interior facing rooms are quieter; you can hear cable cars starting at 5a from city facing rooms.

review.title: Surprising nice and quiet hotel right off Union Sq
review.reviewText: The hotel was comfortable, beautiful and quiet.  I was concerned about the noise because of its location; however, I did not hear any outside street noise.  It was perfect.  The staff was friendly.  The location couldn't be beat.  Figuring out how to get to their valet was the most difficult thing.  Other than that, everything was great.

review.title: We changed the hotel the same night we arrived
review.reviewText: We did not like the hotel. It needs an urgent renovation.

review.title: Nice location
review.reviewText:
The location is good, close to everything. The staff are very helpful. There is no microwave in room, so I asked the staff at the front desk if there is a microwave I can use to reheat some food, she immediately had my food reheated by the microwave in the employees' room and delivered my food to my room.

But the hotel smells. The moment you enter the elevator you can smell that disgusting odor. The AC is installed at an awkward location that it blows cool air right toward the bed.

The room is overall comfort in spite of the disgusting smell.

review.title: Right in the heart of Union Square
review.reviewText: Stay here was good. The hotel is an older building, which certainly added to the character, but the hallways did smell a little "old". The room was fine. Nothing crazy fancy, but very clean, nice bedding, TV, etc. The bathroom was very small (again, older building), but fine. If you are looking for something right in the heart of city/Union Square, this is a great hotel. The restaurant, Kuleto's, is a great restaurant and you get a discount to dine there. They have a business center too. If you are looking for luxury, I don't think this is it, but it was a nice stay in a nice hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Hallways need to be updated (carpet, paint).
review.locationRemarks: TONS to do. Shopping, theater, restaurants, people watching. Cable car directly in front of hotel.

review.title: What a perfect location!
review.reviewText: Room was very cozy... No view to speak of but very comfortable. The location couldn't be better for the price. The restaurant was fantastic!! One of the best meals I have ever enjoyed.
review.positiveRemarks: Very comfortable bed and very clean.
review.negativeRemarks: A coffee maker I the room would have been appreciated!
review.locationRemarks: It seemed like we were right in the heart of the city.... We walked out the door and everything was right there!

review.reviewText: The sixth floor had an awful musty smell as soon as you got off the elevator. It looks like a very old hotel that just had some cosmetic renovations.

review.title: Great Hotel for tourist.
review.reviewText: This hotel was top notch. The staff was excellent. A little busy on the streets but it was in the heart of Union Square. I would definitely recommend for first timers in SF.

The AC doesnt work
Beds are not comfortable at all
Definitely over priced given the condition of the rooms but location can't be beat. Very nice staff as well.

review.title: WOuldn't stay again
review.reviewText: loud music on street kept me up (needed to rest for conference), smell of mildew, fast internet (good), tiny room,, good price, friendly staff, tiny stairways/elevators, tiny bathroom...worst was sound on street on a monday night ,local establishment had a live band planing wel into the night, and I needed to rest for a busy conference (Games developer conference GDC).  ..place did have fast internet (tested at 40-50 Mb Down on 2nd floor), small business center if needed, seeminglly a nice but expensive restaurant onsite, and a small cafe before leaving to the street level (espresso/latte, etc...)...Probably an okay place as a last resort, but wouldn't stay again....too many negaitves..
review.positiveRemarks: interenet speed, proximity to Moscone center
review.negativeRemarks: mildew smell, loud street music
review.locationRemarks: close to moscone center, parking, restaurants/

review.title: SF Weekend
review.reviewText: Love this hotel and the location is great. We went to a matinee play at the Golden Gate Theater and then over to John's Grill for dinner....wonderful time in the city. The Villa Florence took care of all our needs and the room was beautiful....nice bed.
review.positiveRemarks: They let us check in early
review.locationRemarks: Close to Golden Gate Theater and walking distance to all the fine restaurants near by. Perfect location if you want to ride the cable cars around SF

review.reviewText:
Great hotel and staff in a prime location!
Only thing is that the beds are a little stiff and uncomfortable but overall a nice hotel.

Valet parking full.  Hotel condition mediocre 
Staff were friendly.

review.title: Nice location
review.reviewText: Nice hotel really close to shopping district. Staff are really nice and very helpful. Restaurant not so good expensive, service are slow and the food are terrible.

review.title: Nice hotel within walking distance of things to do
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful stay. Everyone on staff was very helpful especially those who worked at the concierge desk.  They were so willing to make reservations, call for taxis or shuttle vans, suggest restaurants, and explain the best ways to get around town.  The bed was very comfortable.  Our room was clean but a little small.  I do think that comes with staying in such old buildings.  However, the hotel was lovely.  I would stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Close proximity to things we wanted to do

review.title: Nice hotel close to amenities.
review.reviewText:
Nice clean hotel.  Rooms are small but quaint. Staff at desk are friendly & helpful.  Can't say much about the door/bell man--doesn't have the decency to greet, let alone open doors for guests.
Hotel close to restaurants, shopping & transportations.  
Hotel gauges their guests on extra fees & taxes.

review.title: Great location, great expereince
review.reviewText:
I was somewhat concerned because of the lower ratings but found on all accounts the hotel was an excellent value. The hotel is not a Four Seasons or the Ritz but I seldom can the cost of staying in those facilities. I enjoyed the smaller hotel atmosphere, good dining, and the location is excellent. 

Everything is within easy access to include the cable car passing in front. So a quick ride to Fishermans Wharf is not only easy but practically mandatory. And if you want to go elsewhere on the cheap the Bart is only 2-blocks away. Of course, all the shopping and restaurants of Union Square are within walking distance.

Staff was courteous, but the truth is there was not any issues that I needed assistance with. The room itself came with a very comfortable king-bed and a 50" TV and the adjoining room a sofa, chair and another 50" TV. The bathroom, small but updated with all new fixtures. 

Is it the Ritz, no, but to enjoy yourself in downtown San Francisco at a reasonable price, I would recommend.and I will be staying there again.

review.title: Great location, friendly & accommodating staff
review.reviewText:
Picked this hotel after our connecting flight was cancelled based on location & appealing name. Great choice!
Close to bart airport train station (Powell). Attentive staff. Pleasant decoration & comfortable room.
Also has a great restaurant with outstanding service, breakfast  & very good coffee.
There is a cable car stop 2 mins away, nice ride!

review.title: Room was great
review.reviewText: It was great. Oops! Please add a bit more to your review.

review.title: Nice hotel.. hard to locate ...
review.reviewText: This hotel was nice. Staff was helpful, and friendly. We booked a Jr suite, it was cute & comfy for two adults & child. The condition of room is clean with some worn out spots.. Little things like scrapes & scratches.. Some dust.. But it was an over all good stay for us. However locating front entrance of hotel was a mission. I guess that is to be expect when driving in SF.

review.title: The Expedia price isn't the real price
review.reviewText: The price you see on Expedia isn't the actual price base price for this hotel. Villa Florence adds an extra, mandatory "administrative fee to the quoted room price, for "amenities" like newspapers in their business center and their exercise facility. " This added $32 to the Expedia price, before taxes. This may also be true of other Union Square hotels. Beware!
review.negativeRemarks: Quote the actual base price for the room

review.title: Not what we booked
review.reviewText:
We were four women traveling on a girls weekend and had booked two full beds in one room to share. Unfortunately, upon arrival we were told there was only a king bed available - Or they could "upgrade" our room to a king suite. Clearly having no other choice, we took the "upgrade" even after showing the desk attendant a confirmation email indicating our original booking.
Upon arriving in our room, it was clear that our "upgrade" was a king bed and pullout couch. Two of us slept in the king bed, and my sister and I slept on an uncomfortable and thin mattress on a pullout couch. Additionally, there was a dirty shirt from a previous guest left in the closet and a half empty water bottle left in our room as well. It was definately not the "4 star" experience we expected.

It's location puts you in the center of Union Square -- shops, sites and public transportation (including SF's famous cable cars). It's cute, quality boutique hotel that combines vintage charm with modern style. It made for a pleasant weekend stay.

review.title: Business Stay
review.reviewText: Property was in a great location but the room was way too small.  The toilet was so close to the wall it had to be mounted off center so it could be sat on.  Property had an odor throughout...not sure if there was a plumbing issue or what but the hallways and elevators did not smell inviting.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms need renovation. Uneven floors (under the carpet), doors, moulding and windows.

review.title: great location for tourists
review.reviewText: Great location, right on Powell (if you're a light sleeper, make sure to bring ear plugs because you can hear the street cars running). Walk anywhere easily, good for business travelers also with a short 10 min walk to the financial district.

review.title: Unique hotel and close to everything!
review.reviewText: Loved the room, Kuletos for breakfast was AMAZING! Great staff as well.
Overall a great experience. The room was gorgeous. Only downfall is we took forever finding the entrance. I would definitely stay agin

review.title: Nice European feel! Could be in Paris or Rome!
review.reviewText: Nice to have Kulleto's attached to Hotel! They even offer a discounted food bill if you're a guest at the Hotel!

review.title: Nothing good of this place !!!
review.reviewText: First, they are short from staff, second, the quality of services is very poor, you càn feel it since you do the check in. Third, hotel rooms has a ràre smell, rooms are very small, the shower tub gives you small amount of water. Overall, if you just want something near from the Union SSquare this is your option. If not, go to 5 star hotel.

review.title: Great location, right on the Cable Car line
review.reviewText: Convenient location for us to get to our work related business but then to be able to close the night with some fun.

review.title: Good hotel, great location.
review.reviewText: It's a good hotel in a great location. Older hotel but clean and mostly well maintained. Overall good.

review.title: Nice Hotel, Great location!
review.reviewText: This was a very cute hotel with a nice quaint restaurant too boot! We stayed here for a weekend getaway and had a junior suite which was lovely. Nice bed and living area.
review.negativeRemarks: They need to clean the hotel areas better. The cabinet with the wine showcase had not been dusted for ages and there where carpet fuzzies to pick up.
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown is not far and Union square is right there! Easy transportation area as well.

review.reviewText: Great location, excellent stay and good expresso at the lobby for the coffee lovers

review.title: Can't beat the location
review.reviewText: You can't go wrong with the Villa Florence. It is reasonably priced for Union Square. It's location is excellent- especially if you are relying on BART to get you from an airport to the hotel- 2.5 short blocks from the station. The service is excellent. It is right on the cable car line, which might make you think that it's noisy, but our room was silent. If you are shopping- it's all right outside the door. The central location makes it easy to get anywhere on public transit. This is an old hotel, so the rooms and bathrooms are small, but they are well appointed and furnishings seem to be recently updated. The hotel bar has happy hour every day and the restaurant, Kuleto's, while no longer the trendy restaurant it once was, stills serves excellent food. The "resort" fee entitles you to 20% off food and bev in both places. I thought the only down side was the hard bed and so-so linens and that resort fee. If I had been there for business, I might have used more of the features the resort feel gets you.

review.title: Moldy and bad staff reception
review.reviewText:
We checked in the evening of 3 Jan and the receptionist was shockingly rude (or racist)! Dante (name of receptionist) said he was surprise that we speak English without an accent because our names were not "American sounding." He then tried to make a joke asking to hear our response between my sister and I in another language! Not what I expected from a four star hotel. Just get us a good room and lay off the ethnic jokes please!

We then found that the room we reserved  was unavailbale (two queens in deluxe room) because there were many guests. So I was charged for the same amount but got two full beds instead. Then the bathroom had molds along the walls!!! Worst experience ever.

review.title: Good location, nice rooms, decent price.
review.reviewText: This hotel is between Union Square and Powell St. station, making it very convenient for shopping and getting around the city. The price was OK, and the staff was helpful and friendly, though checkout was a bit slow in the morning. There was a (singular) bug in the bathroom, but the room was nice and clean overall.
review.positiveRemarks: Good location. Nice Staff. Good room.
review.negativeRemarks: Free toothbrush would have been nice.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square and Westfield Mall have lots of shopping options. Plus it's near Muni and BART, making it very easy to get to other parts of the city/bay

review.title: Lovely hotel and a great location!!
review.reviewText: I had a six night stay at the Villa Florence.  I flew in early morning from Australia, and went to see if they could mind my bag until check in time.  They were able to give me a room early, which was very appreciated.  The rooms were very clean, and very nicely decorated.  The staff were friendly and the location of the hotel was excellent.  I highly recommend this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Lovely hotel in a great location.  Wonderful friendly staff.  Highly recommended.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: About 100 meters to Union Square.  Macy's is just across the road.  About 2 blocks from Market Street, and the BART and MUNI.

review.title: Staff was VERY accommodating and friendly.
review.reviewText:
Can we check in early? ...Yes, absolutely!
Would you hold our suitcases all day after checkout? .. Yes, absolutely! 
Great customer service.

review.title: Rooms are dusty
review.reviewText: I reserved two rooms. One for me and another for my parents. Both were so dusty all of our allergies flared. I'm not normally prone to allergies so this room must have been extremely dusty. The heater in the room also didn't work so the hotel provided a space heater. Parking is inconvenient because the hotel is on a road you're not allowed to drive on.  The hotel has two spots open for valet ($57/night) but if the spots are not open, you have to drive around until one is. With traffic, it took about 20 minutes to do a loop. Other option is to do self parking. Location is great--at the heart of Union Square but accommodations were so uncomfortable I will not stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location.  At the heart of downtown and Union Square.
review.negativeRemarks: Room cleanliness. Rooms were too dusty.

review.title: Rooms need work
review.reviewText:
Checkin/checkout process was good. The staff is friendly. It is also ad a good location.
We only stayed for one night but it turned out to be an uncomfortable night. The ac/heater unit was not working properly. It was not heating and too loud. It was also misplaced (right next to the bed at the same level) and was blowing air right on the face of the person lying on it. Could not even turn it off. Since it was a one night stay we did not make a big deal out of it but for the room should have been inspected before letting anyone stay in it.
review.negativeRemarks: Room conditions
review.locationRemarks: Next to union square. Good place to stay to go around downtown.

review.title: Nice hotel in Union Square
review.reviewText: It is in a great location, with cable cars and restaurants within walking distance. We arrived early and appreciated the staff person at the front desk, accommodating us with an available room. We were told that if we eat and drink at the hotel, we would receive a 20% discount. There is a coffee bar and pastries in the lobby as well as the Kuletos Restaurant. We used the coffee bar on December 31 and dined in Kuletos for New Years Eve. The coffee bar and Kuletos restaurant were closed on January 1st. It was disappointing, because we had planned on using both on that day. We couldn't understand why both would be closed, when the hotel seemed to be busy for the holidays. Also, they were doing maintenance in the lobby and the restaurant, which is adjacent to the lobby. There were people cleaning the carpet and a ladder was up in the lobby. We were there for the holidays and we felt as though work was being done right underfoot. It seems they could have scheduled all of that at a different time.
review.positiveRemarks: We like the ambiance of the older hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: We tried to telephone housekeeping, the concierge and front desk, several times and did not get an answer.
review.locationRemarks: There are many things to do. Shopping, cable cars, site seeing and restaurants.

review.title: Great location and reasonable price
review.reviewText: It has a great location and it is reasonable priced.

review.title: Downtown boutique hotel
review.reviewText: Typically tiny room even with a king bed.  But the room is clean and quiet, and  the bed extremely comfortable. Next door is an awesome bakery/coffee shop.  Only problem was had to search 3 different floors to find an ice machine with ice in it.  Will definitely stay again.

review.title: Nice place in a great location
review.reviewText: Check in and out was super fast. We were even allowed to check in a little early which was very nice considering we had a long flight. The building is your typical older building however, it's been renovated and looks very nice. Great location with pleasant and helpful staff. The only negative thing I have to say is the room scent was awful. The scent almost smelt like pet urine but after running the fan for a few hours the smell seemed to die down. Other than that everything else was great.

review.title: Good location.
review.reviewText: Minuscule bathroom and a window heater that never worked properly.  Front desk staff quite pleasant but but the desk is woefully under staffed, i.e. only one person handling checking in & out.
review.negativeRemarks: Add staff and training.  Update heaters and A/c-heating system.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent

review.title: Definitely overpriced.
review.reviewText:
I was very disappointed with this Hotel.For the money they charge you would expect something better,but it is same like cheap motel.
Old hotel,stinky.They upgraded couple things,but not enough.
It really smells in the room and in corridors.Heating is barely working.It takes hours before we feel any heat and it is very noisy.
Breakfast and parking it's not included.
The hotel is definitely overpriced.
I guess you just paying for location,but it's not worth it.
review.negativeRemarks:
Smell in the room and in corridors.
Washroom needs update and better heating should be done.

review.title: Quiet rooms available in the heart of San Franciso
review.reviewText: Appreciated the half to one block experience near Union square. The 2 public parking facilities on O'Farrell near the hotel was a blessing especially after Xmas ! The  wonderful restaurant and bar in the hotel was an added bonus. Wish they had 2 queen bed rooms and not just double beds. Rooms allowed a quiet sleeping experience; a first for us.

Hotel staff was not very friendly. The hotel is a great location. Rooms are small unless you upgrade to a suite. The suites are nice. Rooms are clean. Water pressure is not good. The hotel is old but upgraded. The restaurant had very slow service and the food was very expense for what you got.
review.locationRemarks: shopping, bars, restaurants

review.title: I froze in the hotel room they sent someone up but
review.reviewText: by the time i got there at night the room was freezing, i couldn[t use the shower because of my pheriphal neuropathy and told them i had that before checking in i said i needed a tub and toilet with bars, not a shower that the water went all over the floor which i could walk on or i would fall.l  finally left 2 days early, i tried to get a 3 day refund after i saw the room, but they gave me a hard time and finally competed me 1 day instead of 3
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel staff, except the maid who was so rude, were very nice
review.negativeRemarks: have heat in the room and in the bathroom
review.locationRemarks: i don't know, i just stayed there because my son didn't have handicapped facilities

review.title: Good location to be in the middle of it all
review.reviewText: This hotel is a nightmare to check in to. The greeting the staff gave me was absolutely horrible. One of the check in people asked me if I was someone else and when I told him no he just went back to what he was doing. The room was nice but our heater did not work and we had to call the front desk. The bed was ok but the pillows not so much. It was very clean though and the location was central to everywhere we wanted to be.

review.title: Christmas trip to the City
review.reviewText:
My friend and I have been staying at Villa Florence for an overnight at Christmas time for over 25 years. In that time it has changed from time to time. We've tried other hotels, but always come back to this one. 
Albert has worked there for many years and has retired in the past year. We missed him and his excellent service. 
The hotel did have a note about us liking a corner room and we were delighted to be assigned one without asking this year. However, there is no longer coffee in the room, there was only one extra blanket and my friend was cold and actually covered herself up with the towels from the bathroom. When we mentioned this to the person at the desk in the morning, he said 'well you should have called the front desk.' He was really not apologetic. 
The number of 'freebies' at Christmas has decreased to just a discount at Kuletos. No coupons, or wine from 4-6.
I used the valet service and as I went to get into my car, the fellow at the door asked if I needed directions to get to where I was going, which was nice, but left me to struggle to get my own bags in the car. 
We will probably be back, it is a tradition with us, but I've lost a bit of that warm feeling I used to have about Villa Florence.
review.negativeRemarks: Service
review.locationRemarks: Union Square is the place to be at Christmas. This year we walked up to the Fairmont Hotel and saw the huge gingerbread house. Fun

review.title: Beautiful place in Union Square
review.reviewText: We will be coming back to this beautiful hotel. Anna at the front desk was very nice and responsive to our request for a room change. Our 10yr old really wanted a room with a view of the city, while we knew it would be noisy, it was just perfect for us. Loved the restaurants next door. Christmas time in SF is beautiful, Villa Florence just made it an even more beautiful experience.

review.title: Overrated, understaffed, Poor service,
review.reviewText:
Booked through Expedia claiming to be a 4 star hotel. 1) Drove around for more than an hour and a half trying to valet at the hotel. There is no valet parking or parking on site. You have to wait for a street spot to become available to 
drive directly into, and the are only 3 spots which are always full, due to inadequate valet service st the hotel. Did I mention that this a TROLLEY STREET? YOU CANNOT EVEN STOP ON THE STREET. We almost got hit by the trolley, yelled at by the police, and ticketed for trying to stop in front of the hotel to call for the valet. 2) The front desk, and all other lines are constantly busy from the hotel room. They are understaffed. You are on your own at this "4star"
Great location to down town, shops and restaurants.

review.title: Terrible Experience with this Hotel
review.reviewText:
I stayed one night on a business trip. All I wanted is a decent night sleep at 4 star hotel... did not get it! Rooms facing the street are very noisy but that was not big deal since at SF center that's kind of what you get with boutique hotel. The problems were the refrigerator noise, A/C fan Noise (no ability to adjust down) and A/C Blowing directly at the bed (no adjustments). Beyond that.... No tea in the room and staff was sending me to Wallgreens to get tea (are you kidding me?).
To me if you can't guarantee good night sleep you can't be 4-stars.
review.negativeRemarks:
- AC Noise
- AC direction
- Refrigerator Noise
- No tea in the room
- Staff being professional and understanding the customers

managementResponses.response:
Dear Alan,
Thank you for taking the time to share such valuable feedback. Please note that all of our rooms, except the Deluxe Double, have desks and that the sides of the night stands and desks, when applicable, offer extra outlets and USB outlets. 
We hope to weclome you back very soon!

review.title: kuletos
review.reviewText: i like to stay at villa florence because it has a very fine restaurant, kuleto's. great atmosphere and very good food.
review.positiveRemarks: a nice play to stay. have been staying there for decades
review.negativeRemarks: would be nice if the room had a desk and more plugs

managementResponses.response:
Dear Olivia,
Thank you for the review! We're so glad you enjoyed your visit with us and got to make good use of all the wonderful shopping right at our doorstep!

review.title: Amazing experience
review.reviewText: I loved this hotel! It was in there perfect location right off of union square, less than a block from Macy's. Surrounded by lots of shops and restaurants. The room was comfortable, spacious and clean. It was a great experience

review.title: Noisy hotel close to downtown
review.reviewText:
Overall the hotel looks and feels decent. A bit older, but has it's charms. The room itself was clean, the bathroom less so. The noise level made it impossible to get any rest. Staff were friendly until the complaints came, and turned unprofessional hostile when a room change was requested.

The non-management staff (front desk, concierge, etc.) were all quite friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: Sound isolation / noise reduction, more professional management, cleaner bathrooms.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for taking the time to share your review of your recent visit! We hope you'll come back again soon!

review.title: Central and Affordable
review.reviewText: A decent hotel with reasonable rates and very convenient to everything in DT San Francisco!

review.title: Perfect location and comfortable accommodations
review.reviewText: The hotel is perfectly located downtown. The staff was exceptional and the room was very charming. The room and bathroom were small, but we don't mind that since we don't travel to spend time in the room. Overall zero complaints and would definitely stay here again.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Jeroen,
Thank you for the feedback; we've certainly not had the elevators described in that way and are actively looking to  find a solution!

review.title: Good hotel. Good value for money. smelly elevators
review.reviewText: Great value for money. If only the elevators and hallway could smell less like diapers.....

managementResponses.response:
Dear Joel,
Thank you for the feedback; we're very glad to hear you enjoyed almost all of your stay but also thank you for highlighting some great training opportunities for our staff. 
We hope to welcome you back very soon!
Best,

review.title: Classic looking.
review.reviewText:
The Villa Florence has an excellent location.  Get off the Bart at Powell St and walk up two blocks; you're there. Situated half a block from Union Square, this hotel is smack in the middle of San Francisco's high-end shopping district. The Embarcadero is a close enough walk nearby, and it's just steps to the financial district.  And of course, the classic cable car that all tourists must do at one point or another goes right by the front door!
When my wife and I checked in, apparently their computer systems were down. The staff seemed to be handling it fairly well, but certainly lacked the smiles that I'd usually expect from the front desk. Upon check out, one of the doorman couldn't help complain about the situation to me. I had an excellent conversation with the other doorman, however, about Uber and the taxi situation in San Francisco.
