The hotel itself is old but still quite beautiful. You have to enjoy that sort of ornate decor to like it.
Since there are so many hotels in the area, though, the competition is high, and nothing makes me want to stay here again, as opposed to try out the others.
review.positiveRemarks: Power and USB outlets on the sides of both night stands was a great touch. A fold out mirror in the work desk turned it into a makeup desk; very nice!
review.locationRemarks: Situated half a block from Union Square, this hotel is smack in the middle of San Francisco's high-end shopping district. The Embarcadero is nearby.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for sharing your feedback of your recent stay; we're glad you were able to find alternate parking and didn't mind walking over. We hope you will come back again very soon!

review.title: Central location. Close to everything.
review.reviewText: Too bad the parking is expensive but nothing we can do about it in the city of San Francisco. Parked in the mall and walked oved. Paid 36 instead of 58 like the hotel charges. Check in was smooth, room was fine.

review.title: Nice older hotel very close to union square
review.reviewText: The room was clean,staff very helpful. Excellent location for shopping at union square and westfield. The cons were room was a bit small and the ac/heater did not cut off.

review.title: Location
review.reviewText: Difficult to access valet, wound up self oarking around the block and walking in. Room was very small but it was convenient to central core so not much time spent inside.

review.title: Steps away to Union Square.
review.reviewText: This hotel is older but very well kept. Recently updated and looks great! We had a double non smoking room and loved it. Only down fall is the heaters take awhile to heat up the room but my husband was ok with that (hot blooded ). The restaurant and coffee bar are a little pricey but what isn't in San Francisco. The staff was outstanding! Definitely coming back, we had a great time!

review.title: The heart of Powell street
review.reviewText:
Great location on Powell street. Amazing staff including the doorman working on November 21 at 6pm ... always going above and beyond. Thank you so much and sorry I didn't catch your name. 

The hotel is beside a 24 hour Starbucks and cable cars.

The drains in the shower and sink are horrible and do not function well. The TV is a massive a 60 inch. 

Powell street does have a great deal of homeless and of mentally ill roaming around.
I would certainly stay at the Villa Florence again, and recommend it to friends.

review.title: Nice hotel next to shopping
review.reviewText:
The hotel was very close to the start of the cable car line. Shopping was very easy to walk to. The resturant in the hotel was very good, and if you don't mind a bit a noise, and enjoy watching pros, sit at the kitchen bar.  There are many different types of resturants near by. It is a busy area and full of people going places. Public transportation stops are close, and not just the cable car line.

The staff was friendly and helpful. On checking out, the front desk wanted to charge me for a day, but once I pointed out that the trip was already paid for through Expedia, she did some work on the computer and said that I was good to go, and I might see an email from Expedia.
review.positiveRemarks: The location was very good. There were lots of things near by to do and see.
review.negativeRemarks: One of elevators smelled very odd. The wireless kept going out.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel was on Powell right near Market, very close to a BART exist.

review.title: Unforgettable Experience
review.reviewText: Carla helped make this an experience my wife and I will never forget.  We booked a last minute stay at Villa Florence for our one year anniversary.  I called the hotel after booking and Carla helped me out to make this a special experience for my wife and I.  Her willingness to help and cheerful attitude made this last minute trip effortless. Thanks Carla!
review.positiveRemarks: Customer Service, cleanliness, ease of booking

review.title: Room was too small for 3 people
review.reviewText:
The room was ok but it is too small for 2 adults and 1 kid.
Little room to open two suitcases.
Bathroom is small too.
The hotel is in a great location and close to everything. The rooms were ok, when I got off the elevator the floors smelt very weird thankfully the room itself did not smell.
review.negativeRemarks: The smell, a bit outdated technology

review.title: Beautiful hotel in a sketchy location!
review.reviewText: Hotel, restaurant . staff everything was great, lots of places nearby to eat and shop. Just the vagabonds in the area are sketchy and you really must look over your shoulder esp at night.  $60 per night to park is a bit extreme.

review.title: Wish I would have stayed here sooner
review.reviewText: This is the best boutique hotel my wife and I have stayed in. So quiet [we had an inner courtyard room]. The bed, towels, pillows were very comfortable. Also, by staying at the hotel we got 20% off the price of Kuleto's restaurant downstairs and the coffee shop near the front lobby. Both are excellent. The location downtown couldn't be better. It is close to everything and public transportation is very convenient. Hotel valet parking is very expensive. We found a close-by parking garage at 433 Mason St. You can access it by Googling "Parking Panda."

review.title: Location of hotel was nice.  Myroom was small.
review.reviewText: My friend received a nicer room and he paid the same price.  My room was small.  The bathroom needed work. Shower flooded into bathroom.  No view.  If I paid less I would have been more accepting. I felt cheated.

review.title: Everything in one place, the bar at night is a win
review.reviewText: Last minute booking, great location, price, and rooms.  In room AC was super noisy.
review.positiveRemarks: On site restaurant, cafe, and bar.
review.negativeRemarks: Make AC/heat more quiet.

review.title: Great location and beautiful accommodations.
review.reviewText:
A little noisy in the evening like any city hotel, but easily drowned out by the AC fan.

Very comfortable and a huge tv.

review.title: Just ok
review.reviewText: The room are small and smelly... They didn't care about my gold expedia status and didn't upgrade. At first they give me a room with a wall view i was upset and ask for a different room they change it but nothing really better. I would not considerate this hotel again for my next trip in San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: I
review.locationRemarks: Good location but not great

review.title: Great downtown location
review.reviewText: I stayed for two nights and the hotel was great. A nice breakfast spot right next door. The hotel staff was very friendly  and accommodating. Our room as very small but it was fine for our needs It felt like Italy actually. The only horrible thing was that my credit card was stolen from my room. It was my spare card and in a makeup pouch. I noticed the day we left that I had charges on the card that were not mine and then realized it was not in the makeup bag.  There was a safe in the room. I would HIGHLY recommend using it for valuables. Don't make my mistake.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel had a very European feel.
review.locationRemarks: This hotel is perfectly located by union square, great shopping and close to a cable car stop.

review.title: Fair hotel in a convenient area.
review.reviewText: Villa Florence is a very old building. It is charming but needs some upgrades. Our bathroom door did not close and we asked for it to be fixed, but we're told that it was "old". The bathroom also had a funky odor. The air conditioning was loud and not very efficient. On the good side, the staff was very friendly and helpful. We would probably not stay there again.

review.title: Nice location
review.reviewText: Easy walk to everything. Hotel was built in the 1930s as I was told, and had that old building flare, smell, elevators and architecture. Good stay.

review.title: ambiance
review.reviewText: very warm & italian ish feel.  felt upscale and liked the decor.
review.negativeRemarks: a/c was loud.
review.locationRemarks: loved the lobby and bar.  loved the outside seating.  only hotel around with outside seating.

review.title: Nice hotel great location room a little small.
review.reviewText:
The location of this hotel is amazing!  The hotel itself is wonderful and the lower leve restaurant is beautiful. Only problem we had was that the room was a bit on the small side. 

My knee has numerous Knicks from getting by the bed without hitting it. Clearly unsuccessfully!
Very small room, difficult for 2 more individuals.

My experience at this hotel was terrible. When I arrived the computer system was down so I had to wait a long time until I was able to check in and get a room. The room itself was awful, it was extremely small, probably less than 10 by 10 feet in size, completely not as described. The room also had a window air conditioner which was extremely loud and positioned right next to the bed. I could not get any sleep because of this air conditioner. Overall I would never stay at this hotel again, the room was subpar, definitely not 4 stars. If you do plan on staying at this hotel don't count on being able to get any sleep.

review.title: I was very unhappy
review.reviewText: we arrived Friday night  and there was no one at front desk, then there system was down. Staff was unfriendly. At checkout again know one at desk. It took over 50 min to get our car from valet on Sunday. There system was still down, could not get a receipt with the charges that would be charged. Now Monday still don't know what charges will be.Not very welcoming and very low on staff!

review.title: fabulous decoration and detailed furniture
review.reviewText: nice hotel with helpful stuff and affordable price discount. place is golden place and easy and convenient to go anywhere. room decoration is morden.
review.negativeRemarks: space is  little bit tight
review.locationRemarks: union square, perfect location to anywhere

review.reviewText: Great location...Loud due to cable cars and city life....I had no internet my entire stay

review.title: no wifi
review.reviewText: There was no wifi although it advertises wifi. I had a lot of work to do in the middle of the night after meetings. Very inconvenient and really jammed me up. We checked out a day early because of this.

review.title: Bay Area get away.
review.reviewText: Valet was horrible. Took over an hour to get my car out. They were confused upon our return as to putting it back in valet. Jose at the front was great. Needs some cleaning and updating. Great location.

review.title: Not a 4.5 star by any means
review.reviewText: Had wanted to stay here for years, as I've been coming to Kuleto's every time we come to San Francisco, this was that time. The location is excellent being less than 1/2 block from Union Square and all its shopping, as well as convenient to Market St and the waterfront (Bay bridge area). The lobby looks nice, if you don't inspect the chairs too closely. There were a raft of problems, some of which are an easy and inexpensive fix, and when we informed the staff of them, they just said "sorry", without trying to make any effort to change, the best was on checkout, the customer service manager said that she couldn't do anything about the issues, but here's my card. issues: large gap under room door, smells, noise and light enter the room; loud inefficient air conditioner; horrible stench in hallway (throughout our stay), no hooks in the bathroom (or storage for that matter); tv far too large for the room (and if you are going to the trouble and expense, why not install hdmi and cable boxes to get a better image?), gym smelled so strongly of bleach, it burned our noses. Worst off was the wifi in the room. If it worked at all, it was spotty, even the business centre had problems, with 1 of the 2 computers down at any time, and the printer didn't function one of the days. On a positive note, apparently there has been a recent Reno, and the room furniture is new, with convenient outlets and built in USB chargers to the night stands. It's just not enough to convince me to return.
review.negativeRemarks: Many things (see review)
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, dining, sightseeing, convenient, not far from BART Powell St station

review.reviewText:
Enjoyed my stay.  Perfect location and love the boutique atmosphere.  Staff was alway attentive and professional. 
I would definitely stay again.

review.title: Very helpful staff. Great location.
review.reviewText: Staff was very helpful.  The room was clean and nice. This is an older hotel but many things have been updated. Enjoyed our stay. The 6th floor was very quiet. Great location for walking to shopping and restaurants

review.title: Great location and friendly staff
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay here very much. The staff was very accommodating and the room was clean and very cute. We will definitely try to stay here again

review.title: Don't stay here if you are on business
review.reviewText: No wifi for first two days of my stay and staff kept saying they had someone fixing it, which was untrue, eventually moved rooms and had very spotty wifi, think I was actually getting most from another hotel in the area. Other business people were complaining about this in elevators. By third day they only had one elevator, other one broke down and was not functioning for three days. Don't stay here if you are on business, they don't know how to deal or service business travellers.

review.title: Great Location, terrible view
review.reviewText: I loved that this hotel was close to everything. Great food and lots of things to do just as you step out of the hotel lobby. The view was pretty terrible. I looked into what seemed to be a hostel or halfway house. Either way it was gross. They asked if I wanted to take advantage of their valet and over night parking. I said yes, however, had I known it was going to be $70.00 I would have just taken my car down the street to a $20.00 over night garage. Also, I had three different holds on my checking account. I realize that I have to put a deposit down in case I break something but when I'm on vacation I would like to have access to my money and not have three different pending transactions that aren't even real. I would recommend using a credit card for the deposits and not your debit card.

review.title: Nice hotel in Union Square
review.reviewText: Great location, close to shopping and pubs. Good area to walk around.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Close to shopping and good pubs/restaurants.

review.title: Nice hotel in athe perfect location for S.F. fun!
review.reviewText:
Very helpful and friendly staff, nice room that was very quiet; comfortable, luxurious  bed and pillows.  The room had either not been vacuumed, or not vacuumed well-- I stepped barefooted on what I hope was dried dog food. 
Breakfast at Kuleto's was expensive, and was overcooked Egg's Benedict, a huge splurge for me and a disappointment. 

The hotel however was wonderful, and if I can afford it, I will definitely stay there on my next trip.

review.title: Not worth $250+
review.reviewText: This hotel is at a great location, but is no ways a 4 star property. The elevators and corridor on 3rd floor had a weird smell. The room facing courtyard had construction noise during the night.
review.negativeRemarks: Wifi. That things doesnt work on 3rd floor room. Pricing, no ways this is a 4 star aprox $300 property

review.title: Great shopping location
review.reviewText: Easy to get to, plenty of parking nearby, cheaper than the valet service. Nice snacks in the bar.
Room was very small for the price. Had room facing the street so it was very noisy.

review.title: Great small hotel
review.reviewText:
First night was not so great; the room was above a very busy street, and thus very noisy.
We changed to an inner courtyard room and slept much better.  Great coffee bar, excellent
restaurant.

review.title: Classic but updated with excellent location
review.reviewText: Generally in downtown San Francisco you have to choose between comfort and character.  Either you're in a corporate tower or in an older boutique hotel where you have to put up with excessive street noise and poorly-functioning elevators.  The Villa Florence is ideally located and we found to be extremely quiet and comfortable. A number of the rooms open up onto an internal courtyard and the only noise we heard was a low rumbling of the cable cars. The newly-renovated rooms also have nice features such as USB chargers built into the bed-side lamps which is very useful, especially for international travelers.
review.negativeRemarks: Eliminate the "resort fee". This is a hidden unethical charge for things that are advertised to be free.

review.title: Nice Hotel - Ridiculously bad "incidentals" policy
review.reviewText: The hotel itself is very nice (older and smaller rooms, but very clean and nice), and in a great location.  There is a nice restaurant and small bar onsite, which is very convenient.   My problem with my stay here was the fact that they tack on a $100 A DAY fee for incidentals, and neglect to mention this during check-in.   Be aware of this when you check-in, and plan to use the same credit card for other things.  During my recent 5-day stay, more than $800 was added to my charges for incidentals.  This remained on my card for approximately 5 days.
review.negativeRemarks: Billing practices
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is in the heart of Union Square, and close to everything.  You can catch the Cable Cars just a couple of blocks away.

review.title: Very close to restaurants, transportation.
review.reviewText: very good restaurants nearby.    Walking distance to great shopping.    Easy to travel to other parts of city.

review.title: Busy area
review.reviewText: We tried to check in at 4 pm and room was not ready. Asked for fresh towels and took them 45 min to bring them. The shower knob broke and bathroom wasnt clean. Dusty furniture. Averal i'll never book at this hotel again. Valet parking super slow and there no way to park on the street while you wait for them to take your car.. You have to drive in circles which is a nightmare

review.title: Great walking hotel
review.reviewText: We walked to Chinatown and from A T & T park after a game and Kuleto's is great and Lefty ODouls is right around the corner.  The staff is great and the rooms are nice.  We stay here every time we are in San Francisco.  The only complaint is the different room prices depending on the time of the year and if there is a convention in town.  Consistency would be good.
review.positiveRemarks: close walking distance to many San Francisco attractions and sites.

review.title: Not a 4-star hotel
review.reviewText: When I search hotels in San Francisco, I checked 4 and 5 stars in expedia. Villa Florence came up with a reasonable price. We were shocked when we stepped into this hotel. The building was very old and the room is lack of maintenance. We called the front desk for the repair of the sink in bathroom but never got fixed until we checked out. The hotel is located by the union square, and price is reasonable. However, you pay what you get.
review.negativeRemarks: According to my research, this is only a 3-star hotel. Plz don't mislead your customers by exaggeration.

review.title: Great central location, pleasant entry area, very
review.reviewText: Quiet and comfortable stay.   Handsome décor.  Fair price.

review.title: Location, location, location!
review.reviewText: Excellent friendly and helpful staff!  Awesome location --- cable car runs in front of hotel.  Rooms a little small -- but you shouldn't be staying in your room!
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, cable cars, trolley, or bus takes you anywhere you want to go --- Fisherman's Wharf, UP and down Nob Hill, Golden Gate Park, etc.

review.title: Good location and people - not super luxurious
review.reviewText:
The location was great. Right on union square. Walk downs stairs and shop, eat, jump on the tour bus or take local transportation. 

The hotel itslelf was not my favorite. But it is probably what it was advertised to be if you read the descriptions more thoroughly and don't use the pictures to decide.
It is a remodeled/refurbished hotel. The rooms are tiny and not very fancy. No room service except for a couple hours during dinner. 

All that being said - it fit the bill. The staff was very nice and if you looking for a good location from which to base your travels then it is excellent. If you are looking for a really nice room to spend R&R then spending more money on a newer nicer hotel would be my choice. 

All in all - good place good people good location.

review.title: Nice hotel good location
review.reviewText: Nice hotel close to the most important shops in the diwntown

review.title: Perfect Location for Shopping and Dining
review.reviewText:
This is a BOUTIQUE Hotel....meaning the  ambiance is a retro...type with a comfortable
small room and retro bathroom. Some rooms have an extremely SMALL bathroom making
it difficult to enter as the door hits the closet. Ask for a room with a larger bathroom.

The front desk is very nice as in the Concierge at the hotel entrance.

The WiFi is non existential  In the hotel room...so don't pay extra unless you get it as 
you will be throwing away good money.
review.negativeRemarks: Having the Internet IN the ROOM!
review.locationRemarks: Location is very good for shopping and dining!

review.title: Very charming and great location, but not the best
review.reviewText: In the heart of Union Square and really nice lobby with restaurants and great staff, but the rooms are old and smell old and the bathrooms are tiny.  The rooms only have window air conditioners, so if you are going during the warm season, prepare to be hot.

review.title: Disappointing!
review.reviewText: I stayed at Villa Florence back in Nov 2014 and  had a suite.  The king bed was comfortable and the pillows were large and comfy. My experience was pleasing so decided to stay there again with my teenage son.  The wifi did not work.  We even called tech support.  I had to  use my personal Hot Spot the entire time!  Also, the AC unit did not work.  I had it cranked to 62 degrees and it never cooled down.  Also, the AC unit was loud!!  Room was not great but the location and Kuleto's are fabulous!
review.negativeRemarks: wifi and bed/linens
review.locationRemarks: Union Square

review.title: Stay away
review.reviewText: We started our stay with being dropped off around the corner because the Villa Florence was on a trolley line and the Supershuttle would not make the block, so we had to haul all of our luggage up the hill on a perpetually busy street. Early morning around 7 is the only time you wont't be fighting the pedestrian masses. Our room was not ready when we got there after the stated check in time. They did give us free breakfast one day to compensate. The bathrooms are microscopic. There was almost no room to turn around in the shower. We had to ask for towels multiple times, and one day we didn't get maid service.  The restaurant is very pricey, with the only good meal being breakfast. Go to cafe bellini next door. It is somewhat cheaper, although all food in San Francisco is very very overpriced.  I thought that staying right by Union Square with all the shopping would be great, but we saw a mugging 2 blocks from the hotel plus a marching protest of about 150 people 1 block from the hotel. Also, there are numerous homeless people all over the street plus loads of construction around the hotel. Overall, you are probably better off near Fishermans wharf, even with the crowds and crowds of people.
review.positiveRemarks: The appearance of the lobby and restaurant was nice and staff was friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: Maid service. Printer did not work. Cost of food in restaurant was very expensive. The size of room  for the cost.
review.locationRemarks: Right by Union square. Shopping is available nearby.

review.title: Good location.
review.reviewText: Every thing is within walking distance. Good shopping and food all around the hotel

review.title: Very nice hotel right in the area we wanted to be
review.reviewText: Stayed Friday and Saturday night. No complications and no complaints. The staff were great and very helpful. They parked our car when we got there and used cabs while in town and they brought the car back quickly when we were ready to leave.

review.title: Hallway smells old. Dirty carpets. Mold in bath.
review.reviewText:
The room was dark and very tiny for a deluxe double room. 
Mold in the bathroom. Beside the nice head beds there is nothing appealing about the room. 
Nice lobby but the service is poor in the restaurant. The valet is expensive and slow. You will need between 15 to 25 minutes to get your car back.

review.title: Smallest room
review.reviewText: The double bed filled the room.  The bath was nice, but dated.
review.locationRemarks: Location, near Union Square, was good

review.title: Union Square
review.reviewText:
Great location, clean, staff is extremely nice, especially Daniel!
Room is very clean except the noise from air conditioning is VERY LOUD

review.title: SF family trip...
review.reviewText: Took family to see and explore SF and the near by attractions.
review.positiveRemarks: Centrally located right across from Union Square. Many places to shop and the street cars pass right in front. The burger joint downstairs wasn't bad.
review.negativeRemarks: We were 4 in one room so we booked a junior suite, which included a queen size bed and a sofa bed. Would have been nice if it had 2 beds.
review.locationRemarks: Location is excellent! In the heart of Union Square yet the room was very quite and you would have never known. Wife loved the near by shopping.

review.title: Great location.Nice hotel
review.reviewText: The staff are very friendly.Its a great location,nice comfortable rooms

review.title: Great location, central
review.reviewText: Rooms are small and kind of old but the decor is updated. The guy who checked us in was a jerk...he made fun of my wife's outfit and made a lot of assumptions about us. Super unprofessional. Probably wouldn't stay here again.

review.title: Great Choice :)
review.reviewText: The location is great, the staff are super friendly (offering you a small cold drink while you wait to check in), the room very was nicely decorated and just about everything about it was good.  I would be happy to go back there again.
review.positiveRemarks: There wasn't anything I didn't like about it.
review.negativeRemarks: None.
review.locationRemarks: Great shopping is nearby (the Galleria and Macy's), everything is walking distance even Chinatown and North beach, of course the Union Square park.

review.title: Quiet, comfortable, clean hotel
review.reviewText: We had a very quiet room, hotel staff was always courteous and helpful.
review.locationRemarks: Lots of upscale shopping nearby, theaters to see plays, some restaurants. Jump on/off bus tours nearby. Cable car goes down this street. Very central.

review.reviewText: Good hotel , best service , stuff perfect , love it
There was no bellhopper to help us bring our luggage up, but besides that the rooms were clean and the beds were the most comfortable hotel beds i have ever slept in.

review.title: Beautiful hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText: Lovely hotel with excellent and very helpful and courteous staff.  A little difficult to locate on street with crazy SF traffic because signage isn't prominent feature.  Stunning and charming rooms.  Very quiet.......didn't hear outside street traffic or even other guests. Only minor issue was room was a little warm for me probably because it was a warm summer and SF isn't heavily dependent on AC.  Would have liked to have microwave in room but that is just a personal preference.  I'd definitely recommend this hotel and will probably stay again.

review.title: Nice downtown SF location
review.reviewText:
Check in was excellent. Parking is expensive, $68 for valet overnight. Room was very nice, but small. Bathroom is ridiculously small, with no shelving. Even the pedestal sink design doesn't allow you to use the edge as a shelf. 
Wireless so-so in the room.
review.negativeRemarks: Put up a small shelf for toiletries in the bathroom.
review.locationRemarks: Right on the cable car line with a stop basically across the street. Expect to wait in line for 20 - 30 minutes though.

review.reviewText: Room decor was slightly dated but bed was comfortable and TV was a big flat screen. Staff was great!
Small and Old room, bad noise all night in room, told front desk and they did not seem to care, bathroom had broken sink

review.title: I like to be by union square.
review.reviewText: I hear & see what SFO is all about-the sights, the sounds & the smell

review.title: Location couldn't be better
review.reviewText: The room was quite small. I would NOT recommend upgrading to king size bed because a queen would've had more room to walk around in room. There was no dresser to put clothes. Other than that, location was the best, walking distance or public transportation will reach almost everything. Staff was great.

review.title: Lovely ambiance and excellent location
review.reviewText: Location 2-blocks from BART, on the Powell Street cable car line and kitty corner from Union Square was wonderful.  The lobby was gracious and the integration with the in-house restaurant and coffee/wine bar gave it a nice energy.  It was clear that the restaurant was a local favorite, particularly at night.  Our room was reasonably spacious, comfortable and well-appointed for a renovated vintage property.  The fitness room was modest but adequate, although missing a few dumbbells.  No real drawbacks except for a slightly opaque control interface for the climate control.

review.title: nice hotel right in the heart of SF
review.reviewText: Neat hotel right at Union Square. Very convenient to everything. A lot of shops and nice restaurants near by. The hope on hope off bus stop is right at the corner.
review.negativeRemarks: the air condition in the room is a bit noisy

review.title: Amazing location for tourism!
review.reviewText: We only had two days in San Francisco, and thanks to the amazing location of this hotel, we were able to jump to about six different neighborhoods easily through the nearby public transportation.  Walking distance to Chinatown, the Embarcadero, and much more.  Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone!

review.title: Great location. Very busy street but very central.
review.reviewText:
Extremely busy weekend in SF.
Get an inside room ( jr suite ) absolutely no street noise.
Kuletos excellent. Bar Norcini average. Concierge very helpful.

review.title: Disappointed with the Hotel
review.reviewText: I was in a Deluxe Queen Room and not sure what was deluxe about it. The bed faced a desk and the Television was on that same wall but facing the front door. No chairs other one desk chair. So watching TV was an overall strain. Room service from Kuletos was a great disappointment: not many choices and children's menu was out of all but 1 choice. Then next day housekeeping straightened up the room and left the dirty dishes with leftover food in the room. I had to call front desk at 5pm and request it be picked up. That in itself, was careless and nasty and would therefore I would not recommend your hotel.
review.negativeRemarks:
room set up-better access to watching TV
improve room service
improve HSK service.
review.locationRemarks: great location for travelers for city sight seeing or going to East bay. Convenient to public transportation, excellent shopping.

review.title: Great Union Square hotel with great ammenities
review.reviewText: Great hotel.  A little loud, but it is in the city, so not any louder than I expected.  Hotel staff was fantastic, Room was very comfortable.  Already planning our next stay there.  Located very close to Union Square, BART, and the cable cars.  Fantastic restaurant as well (Kuleto's).  Good bar also.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, comfortable room, great hotel staff
review.negativeRemarks: Some sort of microwave somewhere.  Doesn't need to be in the room, but access to one would be great (we had leftover Chinese)
review.locationRemarks: Great location.  BART was three blocks away, cable cars two.  Union Square was a block away.

review.title: Close to Union Sq. but super small room and smelly
review.reviewText: The carpet really needs some cleaning. It's dirty and smelly. No one seems ever opened the window to let wind in. The room is dark as well. Overall not a good experience except the location.

review.title: It'not worth for the price.
review.reviewText: This hotel is not worth for the price but location is really good. I don't recommand this hotel.

review.title: bad experinces
review.reviewText: no parking in the hotel,outside the front door  smell very strong cigarette and they asking me to park or i will cost me morethan 80 dollars a night, im not even stay in the hotel and they don't want to refund my money...so bad experience in my entire  travel history in my life....

review.title: great location in the middle of everything
review.reviewText: love this boutique hotel - great staff and wonderful location; very clean and comfy

review.title: Great Location but rooms could use an update.
review.reviewText: Villa Florence is in a great location downtown right in the middle of everything including shopping and theaters.
review.positiveRemarks: I like the style and appearance of the front entry, lobby and the restaurant!
review.negativeRemarks: My room was a little dowdy and had a very small bathroom. The neatness of the room left a little to be desired, and was in need of a paint job .
review.locationRemarks: Great location with many Restaurants, shopping and theaters nearby.

review.title: Vintage hotel, nicely renovated
review.reviewText:
There's a lot to like about this hotel.  Staff is friendly and helpful. Lobby is well appointed; room and hallways looked recently renovated.  Location is great.

On the down side, air conditioning was a problem.  It had a remote control but it was unplugged when I first arrived and I spent a fair bit of time with the remote before figuring out it wasn't plugged in.  I had to use a pencil to turn it on (couldn't reach the button through the grill) . There were no instructions so I contacted the front desk for some brief instructions.  And finally it's rather noisy. Bathroom was tiny, with no counter, just a pedestal sink.

review.title: Nice, boutique hotel in downtown near Union Square
review.reviewText: This was convenient to downtown San Fran and Union Square.  The front desk staff asked if we preferred a room on the street or in the back, and we requested the back for quiet and it was totally quiet--even on the night that Golden State won the NBA championship.  Unfortunately the wifi was awful and the price for valet parking was ridiculously high. Overall was a pleasant stay but for the price disappointed with parking and wifi.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was great.  Room was quiet.  Staff was very friendly and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Wifi was awful. Didn't work in the room at all. Tried to get on computer in business center in morning before check out and didn't work there either.
review.locationRemarks: Right off of Union Square--restaurants and shopping galore!

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: GREAT  location, with that said the Warriors had just won the Championship so it was a bit bit noisy from the bar across the street. But nothing but great things to say about this Hotel. They might think about sound proofing the windows and having blackout curtains the next time they remodel but we enjoyed our stay......the cable car bells , the minor street noise  were totally acceptable considering the close proximity to Union Square....GREAT location ! Would definitely stay her again ! Hotel staff was EXCELLENT! Room was small but clean and had everything we needed for our overnite stay . Would stay here again.........
review.positiveRemarks: Freindly staff . Very helpful with suggestions. Grocery / Drug store a block away. Great location!
review.negativeRemarks: A lot of street noise.......I found the cable car bells charming, personnally. Next remodel, they might think of sound proofing the windows .
review.locationRemarks: We took the hop off hop on bus tour and our location was great for that. BART and Mall close by and grocery / drug store within two blocks......

review.title: Older hotel but great location!!!!!
review.reviewText: Older hotel but great location!!!  Directly across street from Macy's downtown, Union Square. Walking distance to Chinatown, Fisherman's Wharf.  Close to BART, muni and cable cars. Many great restaurants in the area!!  Had problems with air conditioning but was fixed immediately.  Would highly recommend!!!
Short stay but enjoyed this hotel very much. Great location and the staff was so pleasant!
Great location and friendly staff. Would stay again.

review.title: Pro/con
review.reviewText:
Great central location. Nice cafe and restaurant.

Rooms can be noisy at night if you are on Powell street side. Cabs hard for doorman to hail, as they are all waiting a half block away at the St. francis hotel. Walk over to the St. Francis. Staff gave us poor advice about catching the cable car down at the foot of Powell where there was a long line, instead of just boarding at the nearest intersection.

We challenged a $25/nite "administrative fee", which was purportedly for wifi (complimentary on the web site), business "center" (two computers and a printer across from the elevators) and the fitness center (a few treadmills/ellipticals/weight machine) in a small room. The charge was not listed as an extra on the Expedia site. The charge was deducted.

review.title: Close to everything
review.reviewText: My husband and I enjoyed our stay here. The hotel is beautiful and historic. The building is older but the decor and furnishings are newer. We just had a little issue with the lights and faucet in our bathroom but other than that it was overall a good stay. The staff is very accommodating.

review.title: Has a certain charm.
review.reviewText: This older hotel has a certain charm. Yes, it smells old; the building is crooked and the corridors are cramped, dark and a bit creepy. But the rooms are surprisingly roomy and quiet for the buildings age and location (kitty corner from Union Square). The staff were very polite. Only two complaints were the HUGELY over-inflated prices on in-room convenience bar items. $8 for a small bottle of Voss water that Walgreens next door sells for $1.35. $10 for a mickey of vodka. Come on! The other complaint was that we requested a cot for our oldest son, and they forgot to have it waiting in the room for our midnight arrival. When they brought it it was covered in dust bunnies like it had been stowed in a closet for several years. They didn't clean it off first and it obviously had bedding on it that was placed some time ago. The cot was way too short for my son's 6' height. But in the end, they did not charge for the cot.
review.positiveRemarks: Location. Quiet part of building. Charm.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom ventilation and lighting. If you were in the shower late at night, everyone else was kept awake by the bright vanity lights in the sink area.
review.locationRemarks: Close to everything...shopping, cable car, BART station, Union Square, restaurants, Fisherman's wharf, Chinatown.

review.title: Great hotel, a steps from Union Square
review.reviewText: We had a great stay, everybody (everybody) was very welcoming and helpful. They have a very good restaurant and cafe/bar.

review.title: Nice Hotel in Declining Area
review.reviewText: I have worked in the SF Financial District for 8 years but don't live in the Bay Area.  I am in the city half a dozen days each month and stay in mid-priced hotels near Union Square, most often in the Tender Nob area.  Villa Florence is a very nice hotel right off Union Square.  Room size, bathroom size, and amenities are typical for SF.  Hotel quality is a little higher than average, parking arrangement is not as good as others.  What was remarkable on my recent visit is how much the area around the hotel has declined in recent years.  I arrived around 11pm and was aggressively accosted by several street people (male and female) within have a block of the hotel. That hasn't happened in areas farther north and west. This is not the fault of the Villa Florence but it definitely impacts the overall travel experience.  I'll go back to the Tender Nob on my next visit.

review.title: Overnight stay
review.reviewText: Nice location, nice staff, clean contemporary facility.

review.title: Staff great , small rooms
review.reviewText: No wifi in interior rooms , had to use my personal data to work .

review.title: convenient location
review.reviewText: Front desk staff were helpful and very nice.  Room was clean.  Lobby was beautiful.

review.title: Smaller than we expected
review.reviewText: First of all, the location was excellent - at Powell Street in the heart of Union Square, and close to multiple Muni bus stops, the Powell Station BART subway and 2 of the main Cable car lines (Hyde and Mason).  As for the hotel accommodations, the room was smaller than we expected from the photos, but it was clean.  The telephone in the room did not work, but we had no real occasion to use it.  We had a party of 4, but they only provided towels for 3.  They provided the extra set when we asked for it.  We had 2 double beds (full-size), and they were not very wide. There were 6 USB charging stations in the rooms for our devices (4 on the nightstand and 2 on the table), so we did not need to bring chargers, just needed the USB cables. The bathroom was TINY!  It could only fit one occupant at a time. The old age of the building was evident in the bathroom sink (no vanity, and exposed hoses under the sink basin).  The windows for our 3rd floor room had no view, just overlooked an alley, so we just kept the interior shutters closed.  The staff was friendly and helpful. If location is important to you, I would recommend this hotel.  If you want luxury, there are probably better options out there.
review.negativeRemarks: Not that anything can really be done about it, but the bathrooms are very cramped.

review.title: Great place to stay on Business
review.reviewText: I needed a hotel close to the CBD and Villa Florence is my on going choice. I stayed there a couple of years ago and so when I decided to visit San Francisco there was no "where should I stay question" I booked in and as usual the room and service were top class
review.negativeRemarks: Nope, just loved it all
review.locationRemarks: Cable car outside the door, handy to Fisherman's wharf

review.reviewText: Grelt hotel when you are in town for a few days. Easiest access to shopping, dining, sightseeing. Restaurant is a great place to hang out for shorter business meetings. Rooms are small.

review.title: Charming clean comfortable in European way.
review.reviewText: Small number of rooms compared to Hilton size hotels, so cozy.  Great restaurant!

review.title: Nice Boutique Hotel Close to Shopping
review.reviewText: Hotel has been recently renovated and it looks great! The rooms are comfortable, the staff friendly and the location is great if you love to shop.
review.negativeRemarks: Street noise carried through some of the rooms
review.locationRemarks: Shop until you drop.

review.title: excellent location
review.reviewText: Upon check in we experienced a few minor issues but they were immediately looked after and we enjoyed the rest of our stay. The staff were very helpful and pleasant. Loved the location too!

review.title: nice
review.reviewText:
short stay but very nice rooms. good experience. the staff was excellent and the decor made it a fun atmosphere. 
the beds are nice. our room was on the smaller side. 
the restaurant and cafe was a good way for us to experience nice dining while being downtown. overall we enjoyed it.

review.title: excellent location, super convenient, great lobby
review.reviewText: Second time I've stayed at this hotel.  Trolley line just outside the front door.  Steps from Union Square.  Excellent location, restaurant great for breakfast.  $15 shuttle ride to/from the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: front desk staff during the day were less than accommodating.  Not friendly, ignored my request to have the sink drain looked at in our room.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, all hop on hop off tour buses just steps away, all shopping within walking distance.  Trolley line right outside the front door.

review.title: Great location! Very nice room very clean.
review.reviewText: Love how close we are to everything with hotel. But the staff is not very friendly. Very snobby don't understand in a business that you rely on people to come back or recommend you. You don't smile or say hello in every position? I stay at the Westin down the street for business a lot and they would never let you enter the hotel without a hello.

review.title: A great hotel in a central location
review.reviewText: I like this hotel very much !!!It is centrally located .It is steps away from the cable car turn-around.It is located near restaurants, shopping centers like Macy's and Hop on Hop off buses.The staff are helpful and kind most specially PAM and Daniel (you guys are the best!!!!)..The rooms are alright .Get their junior suite for bigger space.The wifi is free and so is the breakfast.
review.positiveRemarks: I like the free wifi and free breakfast.I like the central location of this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: maybe provide microwave to long staying guest.and definitely, faster wifi.
review.locationRemarks: This hotel is in central location.It is near the cable car,hop-on hop off buses and  the train station.Restaurants and shopping centers are here.

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText: Staff is friendly & helpful.  Nice Itslian restaurant as well as lobby bar that offers open air seating on Powell,  Queen room was much  smaller than the double/double our travel companions had.  If you want a quieter room request an interior room.  We had a room facing the street and slept just fine.  We actually enjoyed hearing a saxophonists playing on the corner each night.   Earplugs are provided at front desk if you need them. It is a big city, and you cannot beat the location & price Just steps away from Union Square!

review.title: Great location close to Union Square
review.reviewText: The hotel is conveniently located close to Union Square and within walking distance to the Bart station. There are many stores and restaurants in the area. The staff was always friendly and helpful. We stayed in a large and bright twin room with nice decor. We even had a spacious walk in closet thought without any shelf space, only hangers. The room was quiet but the view was disappointing as we could only see the windows of the building next door.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location next to Union Square, helpful and friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: The bathroom was large but the washbasin was small and there was not enough shelf space for my nécessaire or toothbrush.The elevators were very small.
review.locationRemarks: Next to Union Square with many stores and restaurants in the area.

review.title: Nice hotel Central position rooms small.
review.reviewText: Nice character property good for location and price
review.negativeRemarks: Room could be bigger the t v was far too big
review.locationRemarks: Trams run past the door buses close by.  Go to fishermans wharf have fish and chips at the cod mother and visit Alcatraz

review.title: Union Square older but well located hotel
review.reviewText: All good except through wall A/C permits excessive street noise
review.negativeRemarks: Elevators are older, small and unreliable - only one of two working during entire week long stay
review.locationRemarks: Union Square speaks for itself

review.title: stylish hotel Rooms need redesign
review.reviewText:
Lovely hotel. Coffee bar was enjoyable. Great staff. Restaurant Koletos was delicious 
The room was not enjoyable. Difficult to maneuver in room. Couldn't open mini bar door as it was too close to the bed. No curtains over windows resulted in room being fully illuminated during night from street lights. 
Bathroom sink area required creative maneuvering to wash; way too small. 
Heater ran entire time. Had hotel engineer look at it. He was not able to resolve. 
Highly recommend you stop by for coffee/muffin at the coffee bar or dinner at Kuletos. Enjoy the hotel decor. 
Would not recommend staying overnight until they redesign guest rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: Room layout.
review.locationRemarks: A bit of a drive,about 15 minutes, to Golden Gate Park. Very enjoyable museums and gardens. Allow time as there is lots to see.

review.title: An ok hotel at the heart of Union Square
review.reviewText: The hotel is easy to find. The ambience of the hotel is nice. The staff there are super friendly as well. As for the room it had a few nice touches such as the flower head board, giant TV with cable and was fairly quiet. As for the draw backs, the bed was uncomfortable and the sheets weren't so white, stains... There was very little water pressure for the shower and it also would alternate between super hot then cool.. Also the room is heated and cooled by a in windows unit. I also got stuck in one of the small elevators for about 5 minutes. I would recommend this place to someone if they wanted a place to crash for a night or two but if your looking for something more comfortable & relaxing I would look else where.

review.title: Great hotel since it's next to all the shopping!
review.reviewText: It was a great hotel since it felt very fancy. Just didn't like that it took me a while to cancel my other room since I had a medical emergency.

review.title: Quick and qiet
review.reviewText: We came in super late and they were very courteous and helpful. We were only going to be there a few hours to sleep as one of us had a surgery early the next morning. They gave us a quiet little room and sent us on our way. The concierge was very helpful and knowledgable.
Staff was friendly and helpful. The toon was clean and quite.

review.title: Excellent location.
review.reviewText: Excellent location. Most of front desk staff very friendly. Howard (bellman) exceptional helpful!! Small rooms but comfy. Some rooms being updated so noisy in the morning!

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText: We had a great stay at Villa Florence!  I have stayed here before and love the location.  The rooms have all been remodeled and it seemed much roomier than before.  The staff was fantastic and very helpful.  We will come here again on our next visit!

review.title: Old world elegance but modern with great service
review.reviewText:
It was really frustrating to get in front of the hotel and I had to circle around in SF traffic many times. I finally called the front desk and spoke to the guy with the interesting mustache who was a gem and talked me off the ledge. He had concierge and the valet meet me when I drove around again. I thought that was a first class thing to do. The hotel has an old but chic and modern feel. I enjoyed the atmosphere and the very large TV. Great valet service. I liked texting when I needed my car and getting it in about 15 minutes. 

I love Lavazza coffee but the coffee maker didn't work and wasn't plugged in. It should have been replaced. The TV was huge and a nice touch. Nice products in the bathroom. 

The restaurant was nice. I really liked the look and feel.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff especially the front desk (guy with interesting mustache) was great. Concierge was also really great.
review.negativeRemarks: I wish the room had been a bit larger. It was a bit comical to have to bend down or slide across the bed to get from one side of the room to another.
review.locationRemarks: The location is great in the center of downtown SF. It's a minute from Sax's Fifth Avenue, Tiffany & Co, great shopping. Chinatown is close by.

review.title: Great hotel at Union Square
review.reviewText: Me and some friends made a trip to SF to celebrate my birthday and stayed at Villa Florence, first time there for all of us. We loved it! We got the biggest room on the 7th floor right on the corner with the view to Powell St. The location of the hotel is perfect. Half a block to Union square, a couple of blocks to the Powell Cable Car and BART station. You can walk to market street and china town. And the staff are very friendly, we had some homemade limoncello and biscotti at the lobby. And the Italian restaurant there is a must try. There is a Starbucks next door, but before you go get your usual Latte, try the one at the lobby, you won't regret it. We will be staying here again, for sure!
review.negativeRemarks: Lighting on the hallways... Kinda creepy at night.
review.locationRemarks: China town, Market st., Union Square, Sushi Boat (just around the corner)

review.title: Downtown SF
review.reviewText: We loved the accessibility the hotel provided to shopping, Muni and BART. Perfect for a downtown experience.

review.title: Nice hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Great hotel right by Union Square and the cable car. All the high end shops are nearby at Union Square. Walgreens just down the street for anything small that you need and where you can buy public transportation passes.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, modern look of rooms and that the rooms had just been renovated.
review.negativeRemarks: Valet parking is offsite somewhere so it takes several minutes to get your car. I think they share the service with another hotel nearby.
review.locationRemarks: If the only thing I can slightly complain about is the valet service then the hotel did its job. You will enjoy staying here.

afdvfs
One of the staff was brilliant in telling us how to get around SF using the public transport and where to sit to get the best views etc...
review.locationRemarks: Great location for cable car and tram lines. Also in the middle of beautiful stores.

review.title: For a first-time visitor to San Francisco
review.reviewText:
I had no expectations as I arrived in San Francisco for some company meetings. I'm a software engineer and hadn't yet traveled to meetings at our SF office. After a very early morning flight, lots of meetings, and miles of walking, I arrived at Villa Florence. From the outside and the lobby, the hotel looked top notch. Once I got into the elevator and walked the halls, the hallways and the quality of the building itself seemed dingy and creaky. 

However, (and it's a big however) the room itself was fantastic! The bed and sheets and pillows were comfortable and clean. The enormous tv was a welcome surprise. The bathroom was very nice and out of the ordinary. There were little details that were included everyday that I thought were great. 

The atmosphere around the hotel was great, the lobby was great, the hallways are gross, but the rooms are great!

review.title: Convenient because in Union Square
review.reviewText: There is only Valet Parking which is very expensive. Was difficult to pull up to the front because there was no where to pull up. Had to circle several times and call the hotel to tell them we are trying to get to the hotel.

review.title: Good location, good stay!
review.reviewText: The location next to union square was amazing.  Our room was also really neat/unique-- you get that with boutique hotels, and this time we scored an awesome room.  The staff was friendly even at 5:30 am when we had to check out, and the valet parking was helpful.  The only thing I would change is the bed firmness-- it was hard to get comfortable, but we mad it work.  Overall I would recommend the hotel.

Nice hotel in a great location
Breakfast is good and the rooms are recently remodeled...
We arrived at the hotel and right when we pulled up we were greeted by friendly staff. Eager to help and please. The entire staff from valet to front desk were helpful, friendly and pleasant.

review.title: Great, older hotel close to everything
review.reviewText: The hotel is centrally located within walking distance to great shops, restaurants, and bars.  It is in a vibrant, safe area of San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was great and the location was perfect.  The rooms were small but nicely decorated and clean.
review.negativeRemarks: The bathrooms were very clean but extremely small.  I would suggest adding more shelving for personal toiletries would greatly help.
review.locationRemarks: The location is perfect.  Within walking distance to great shopping, bars, and restaurants.  The cable cars run in front of the hotel.

review.title: Details need work.
review.reviewText: We reserved a double, double room for my wife and me and our two teenage sons. The room had apparently been recently renovated and needed to have some of the resulting bugs worked out. None of the individual items were catastrophic, but overall conveyed a lack of attention. Our room was small but we didn't intend to spend much time in it so that was not a huge problem. What were problems were a closet door that wouldn't open fully because it was blocked by the "air conditioner," reading lights that fell from the headboard when we tried to turn them on, a bathroom sink that wouldn't drain because the stopper linkage was not functioning, and not receiving a number of towels that matched the number of guests in the room on the third day of our four day stay. The biggest problem was the inability to cool the room. It was hot enough that we left the bathroom window open all night and I slept on top of the bedding.
review.positiveRemarks: The location a block from Union Square and two blocks from the Powell Street cable car turntable can't be beat.
review.negativeRemarks: Our room needed effective air conditioning.
review.locationRemarks: We left our car at the North Berkeley BART station in long-term parking which cost $7 per day. Parking at this hotel is either $54 or $57 per night.

review.title: Good hotel, but a lot of little flaws
review.reviewText:
Some staff are great, other not really. Rooms are good, but I for instance had an enormously loud fan in the bathroom - which blew cigarette smoke into the bathroom... The restaurant is really good, but overpriced and the settings of both restaurants aren't as private as what you'd sometimes like in an hotel - some great bartenders at the bar though.. 
Nutshell, probably good for a short stay for a romantic getaway (save the cigarette smell), not really an option for business travelers.

review.title: Great location at union square for family vacation
review.reviewText: Hotel location was just right where everything is very close by. Valet parking is bit pricey compare to other hotels. Room was clean but my kids found some left over garbage under the bed. Room did not have enough storage space to put bags and clothing. Room was bit noisy with street noise due to poor sound insulation.

review.title: Horrific experience
review.reviewText:
I have several complaints.  I recently stayed in your hotel to celebrate my husband's birthday and a momentous anniversary.  If I had known that the hotel was in dire need of refreshing, and a little less modern, I would have chosen my go to hotel, the Marriott or the Westin.  I booked the stay through Expedia, but your marketing of the property is expressly misleading.  The hotel smells of old, very old.  The bathroom was clean, but small, so thank you.  The room in total was so small, was not prepared for that.  The carpet and creaking of floor boards was not novelty, but resonated danger and lack of care for an asset.  You need women in the hotel to calm patrons.  Balance.  The men were not kind at all, and were border rude to my husband.  It lacks of true customer service.  I think the restaurant leads the property in ambience, but we chose to go to the W hotel for a meal, simply for the service, quiet, and care that they provide their patrons. I asked to check-out, but the "desk customer service" said I did not have to, especially because he was being chastised by a fellow hotel patron for essentially the same experience.  So, I did not check-out, have no clue of my charges - to dispute, and did not receive a good-bye or thank you.  I was told to look for a summary on my credit-card statement or email.  Rude and lacking in customer success recovery. 

 

Please take these observations into consideration as you attempt to remake your image, as I will relay my experiences

review.title: Tiny room comfy bed
review.reviewText:
I'm always surprised when I buy a room on Expedia only to find out that the charge is  24 percent more than I agreed to. I personally would like Expedia (and every other online vendor) to establish a truth in pricing practice) The room (726) was small but the carpet was thick and the bed was comfy. Attached bathroom was large but no counter space. The closet was big. It was quiet.
Had breakfast at co-located restaurant--twas fine.
Valet parking $54/ night. 
Cable cars run on Powell so was convenient to hop a car and ride down to the Maritime Museum and Fisherman's Wharf area.

review.title: Overprice and disapointing
review.reviewText:
Extremely overpriced hotel. Rooms are tiny. Staff was rude to the point of hanging up the phone on me while I asked for direction.
The hotel is clean. Rooms are clean which is nice.
There is no parking unless you want to pay $50 a day for valet. Very busy street, a total mess to get to.
There is nothing that is outstanding about this hotel, nothing that sets it apart. 
Worth $100 a night maybe and not a penny more. 
You leave feeling ripped off.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff could be nicer. Rooms could not be so overpriced
review.locationRemarks: Close to union square, which is nice, but the streets are so busy and coupled with the fact that there is no parking makes getting to it a nightmare.

review.title: Loved the lobby and bar
review.reviewText: I loved the lobby, the bar, and the restaurant, and computers with internet access available, and our spacious room with lots of big windows and nice decor and linens, and great location for us because near trolley line and bus lines and lots of shopping and union square park.  The hallways showed how old the hotel was but that didn't both me.  I was not happy that we could not take a bath because the plug was broken, and then my son slipped and fell several times while taking a shower because bathtub was so slippery.  When the guy came to bring us a mat and look at the bathtub and bring, he slips on the bathroom floor, which is also very slippery.  Walgreens down the street is amazing resource.
review.negativeRemarks: Put something on bathroom floor and in bathtub so it's not so slippery.
review.locationRemarks: Hotel restaurant was great.  Trolley to North Beach for dinner and back.  Bus to Embarcadero farmer market and walked back to hotel.

review.title: Don't stay here.
review.reviewText: I booked this hotel because it looked nice on the internet.  The lobby actually did look nice in person.  The rooms were a totally different story.  We checked in and went up to our room.  It was not nice, not clean and had a terrible smell.  I went back down to the front desk and told them of the issues and they moved us to another room.  The next room was just as bad and had the same smell.  We decided that we could not stay there and left.  I tried to call Expedia.  I spent 2 hours on the phone (mainly on hold).  I finally was speaking to someone but we were disconnected.  I tried to call back but was back in line on hold.  I decided that I had wasted enough of my time and would call again once I was back home.  We just started walking down the street with our bags and were very fortunate to find a room at the Marriott.  I would totally recommend that hotel.  It was very clean and had a fantastic staff.  They recommended a restaurant called Fish & Farm it was great !!!  If you have a chance go there for dinner.
review.positiveRemarks: The lobby looked nice and the hotel is in a great location.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel needs a major clean / upgrade.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is in a great location.

review.title: Hotel OK, front desk (1 person) not intune
review.reviewText: The room was fine, no view. The issue we had was in a stay change, we reduce the number of nights by checking in 1 night later, phoned hotel and Expedia the Saturday before a Thursday arrival. Hotel refused refund of 1 night, said no calls were made, confused our reservation with another. Expedia agreed to the refund after much time on the phone.
